loans.name: Sare Yeroyel Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Saré Yéroyel est né depuis l'inauguration du banc villageos, le 10 juin 2002. Il regroupe des femmes très solidaires qui mènent des activités de petit commerce. A ce jour elles sont au nombre de 35 femmes.

Madame kadiatou (debout à l’extrême droite)  est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 66 ans, elle est mariée et a en charge trois de ses petits fils.

Elle vend des fruits et légumes, de l’huile de palme et pâte d’arachide dans le marché de son quartier. Elle a  une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant environs dix ans.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter des légumes, de l’huile de palme et pâte d’arachide destinés à la revente.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’assurer les besoins familiaux (habillement, santé, scolarité, nourriture) de ses petits fils.
texts.en:
The Saré Yéroyel Group was created at the inauguration of the village bank, on the 10th June 2002.It brings together women who are very supportive and who work in small businesses. At the present time there are 35 of them.

Mrs Kadiatou (standing on the far right) is the leader of the group. She is 66 years old, she is married and is responsible for three of her grandsons.

She sells fruit and vegetables, palm oil and groundnut paste at the market in her neighbourhood. She has a lot of experience in this field since she has been doing this work for about ten years.

Her new loan will enable her to purchase vegetables, palm oil, and groundnut paste for resale.

The profit will allow her to assure the family needs (clothing, health, school fees, food) for her grandsons.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Khadra

texts.en:
Khadra, a 61-year-old divorced woman, is living with her son in a rented house. 

Although she is living with her son, she chose to do something so she can support herself and help in paying the rent with her son. Since she has prior experience in embroidery and knitting, Khadra decided to continue on that path, so she bought fabric and all the tools required to make embroidered traditional dresses that she now receives orders for. She also added making embroidered pillow covers and table covers too. 

Now Khadra has applied for a loan so she can buy more material and increase her productivity.

loans.use: to buy more material for embroidery

loans.name: Rabaa

texts.en:
Rabaa is conservative person, for that she has her son Yazan to appear in the photo instead.

Rabaa, a 46-year-old mother, is taking care of seven sons and daughters in the absence of their father who works outside the country to manage providing their family a peaceful and comfortable life.

One of her sons, Yazan, 24 years old, is in his last semester majoring in accounting. He is planning after graduation to work in the field to help in supporting their family and preparing for his future.

For that reason, Rabaa has applied for a loan to pay for her son’s semester fees so he can graduate and start fulfilling his dream.

loans.use: To pay for her son’s semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, barrels of cooking oil, packs of sugar, and other food products

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a conservative person, for that reason she has asked her husband Mustafa to be in the photo in her place. 

Linda, a 24-year-old housewife, is married to a male nurse Mustafa who is appearing in the photo; they have three children. 

Four years ago Linda started a small home business selling blankets and clothes, she also sells olive oil when the season comes. Her mother in law also helps her in selling the goods. 

Now she has applied for a youth loan to buy more blankets and clothes.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and clothes

loans.name: Wagne

texts.fr: Madame Wagne est une femme mariée de 45 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce et pratique la vente d’habits, d’encens et de produits cosmétiques. Elle a une expérience de 3 ans dans cette activité. En aidant sa maman dans son commerce  elle a pu être  initiée dans  l’exercice de  cette activité. Les revenus qu’elle gagne lui permet de subvenir a ses propres besoins. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis avril 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 350 000 frs prévu d’une part  pour le règlement d’une commande de karité et d’autre part pour l’achat d’habits lourds a revendre. Il a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur au sein de l’institution. Et les bénéfices qui lui ont été générés par son activité lui ont permis  d’élargir son activité car elle pu se payer de l’encens   qu’elle a envoyé dans une des régions du Sénégal pour la vente.
texts.en: Wagne is a 45-year-old married woman who lives in Senegal.  She is involved in retail, and she sells clothes, incense and cosmetic products.  She was introduced to this activity while helping her mother with her business, and she has since gained a three-year experience in this field.  With her revenues, she is able to take care of her own needs.  She has been a member of one of the UIMCEC branches since April 2011.  She is requesting a loan of 350,000 francs which will be used to pay for an order of shea (butter) and to purchase heavy clothes for resale.  She has already paid back a previous loan to the institution.  The profits generated by her business have allowed her to expand her activity: she has been able to buy some incense which she has sent for resale to another region in Senegal.

loans.use: to pay for an order of shea (butter) to purchase heavy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Julia Elena

texts.es:
Julia es una madre de familia de 39 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el caserío San Pedro San Pablo Somate Alto del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona de clima tropical caracterizado por la producción de frutas como el mango y el limón. La zona se encuentra ubicada en la región Piura, a cinco horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.
La actividad que desarrolla es la crianza de ganado ovino y aves de corral, en la parte posterior de su domicilio, además cuenta con una hectárea de terreno agrícola que su padre le ha dado como herencia, allí ha sembrado limón y lo cosecha semanalmente, tanto su esposo como su hijo la apoyan en las actividades que realiza, existiendo buena relación familiar para seguir creciendo en su negocio.
Ella desea adquirir alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus ovejas y de sus aves de corral, además desea adquirir fertilizantes para su cultivo de limón,  esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio y así mejorar su calidad de vida. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
Ella ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa en el pasado y ha demostrado ser una cliente bastante responsable y puntual con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Julia is a 39 year old mother.  She lives with her husband and son in Caserío San Pedro San Pablo Somate Alto in Tambogrande District which has a tropical climate suited for fruit production like mangoes and lemons.  The zone is located in Piura Region five hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Region’s capital.

Her activity is raising sheep and barnyard fowl in her back yard; she also has a hectare of farmland that her father passed down to her as an inheritance.  She grows lemons there and harvests them weekly.  Both her husband and her son help her with the activities she carries out there being a good family relationship to continue growing in their business.

She wants to acquire nutritionally balanced feed to fatten up her sheep and barnyard fowl and also wants to acquire fertilizer for her lemon crops.  This investment will make it possible for her to continue growing in her business thus improving her quality of life.  

To reach her objective she’s thought it wise to request a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.  She’s had loans with Edpyme Alternativa in the past and has shown herself to be quite a responsible and punctual client with her payments.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her sheep and fowl.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula tiene  43 años de edad, es separada y tiene 03 hijos a su cargo. Vive en el caserío Santa Rosa de Curvan del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona de clima tropical caracterizado por la producción de frutas como el mango y el limón. La zona se encuentra ubicada en la región Piura, a cinco horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.
La actividad que desarrolla es la preparación y venta de comida en su domicilio, para lo cual cuenta con clientela ya establecida, además se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral, los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local, estas actividades las desarrolla desde hace mas de 5 años y le permiten sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Paula desea adquirir alimentos balanceados para sus aves, esto le permitirá seguir creciendo en el negocio y obtener mayor rentabilidad. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
Ella ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa en el pasado y ha demostrado ser una cliente bastante responsable y puntual con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Paula is 43 years old.  She’s separated and has three children in her care.  She lives in Caserío Santa Rosa de Curvan in Tambogrande District which has a tropical climate suited for fruit production like mangoes and lemons.  The zone is located in Piura Region five hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Region’s capital.

Her activity is making food at home to sell; she has an established base of regular customers.  She also raises barnyard fowl which she sells in the local market when they reach ideal size and weight.  She’s been doing these activities for more than 5 years and they make it possible for her to support her children.

Paula wants to acquire nutritionally balanced feed for her fowl which will allow her to continue growing in business and earning higher profits.  To reach her objective she’s thought it wise to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.  She has already had loans with Edpyme Alternativa in the past and has shown herself to be quite a responsible, punctual client with her payments.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her fowl.

loans.name: Elsy Maribel

texts.es:
Elsy, tiene la iniciativa de continuar trabajando con préstamos, con el objetivo de seguir progresando,  comprara materiales para el negocio maíz, leña, gas, cal, para continuar en la producción de las tortillas.
Ella ha tenido una buena experiencia de las inversiones realizadas, mejorando su atención a los clientes, considera que ha mejorado su condición familiar.
texts.en: Elsy has taken the initiative to continue soliciting loans, with the objective of continuously getting ahead. She needs to buy products for her business, like corn, wood, gas and lime powder to continue producing tortillas. She’s had good experiences with the previous loans, improving her customer service and improving her family’s circumstances.

loans.use: buy corn, wood, gas and lime powder.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: Rita es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris, tiene 32 años, ella es feriante de cereales, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 4 años, Rita también maneja una chacra que tiene con su esposo, Rita siempre valora todo lo que Finca Perú le da, con los préstamos ella aprendió a poder invertirlo bien y tener mas capital, también pudo seguir educando a sus hijos, le enseñaron como administrar su negocio, y así pudo progresar en estos 4 años que esta en Finca Perú ha podido ver la mejoría de su situación económica, el préstamo que solicita ahora lo invertirá en la compra de una vaca y alfalfa para poder engordarla.
texts.en: Rita is a member of the 'Arco Iris' (Rainbow) community bank.  She is 32 years old and sells cereals in open-air markets.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for four years.  Rita also runs a farm which she and her husband own.  Rita always values everything FINCA Peru give her.  With the loans, she has learned how to invest wisely and have more capital available.  She has also been able to continue educating her children.  FINCA taught her how to run her business and she has therefore been able to make progress during the four years she has been with them.  She has seen her financial situation improve.  Rita will invest the loan that she is currently requesting in buying a cow and alfalfa with which to fatten it.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Lama

texts.en:
Lama is a conservative person who asked her brother Ahmad to replace her in the photo.

Lama is a 22-year-old single lady, a nursery student at the university. She has two brothers and one sister. Her brother Ahmad has a store selling second-hand clothes and such and she would like to help him so she has applied for a youth loan to enhance the internal decoration of the store so he can show the clothes in a better way.

loans.use: to enhance the internal decoration of the store.

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr:
Madame Binta est une femme mariée âgée de 28 ans et mère d'un petit garçon .
Elle est membre du Banc Villageois depuis le cycle 9 dudit banc villageois. Elle fait partie du groupe de solidarité Bokk jom.

Elle s'active dans le commerce de détails plus précisément dans la vente de téléphone portables. Madame Binta dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce secteur pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis 10 ans.

Avec son nouveau prêt de 500.000 Francs CFA , elle va se payer des téléphones qu'elle va revendre à l'aide de son mari qui le seconde depuis longtemps dans son activité génératrice de revenus.  

A l'aide de ses bénéfices générés par son activité elle va prendre en charges certains besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Madam Binta is a 28-year-old married woman and mother to a little boy.

She has been a member of the "banc villageois" since the 9th cycle of the said "banc villageois." She is part of the solidarity group Bokk jom.

She is active in shopkeeping, more precisely in the sale of cell phones. Madam Binta has good experience in this sector from having worked in it for 10 years.

With her new loan of 500,000 Francs CFA, she is going to buy phones that she will resell with her husband's help. He has been helping with her business that generates income for a long time.

With the help of the profits generated by her business she is going to take care of certain family needs.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (cell phones to resell).

loans.name: Shawgy

texts.en:
Shawgy is a 26-year-old young man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He couldn't access an education due to his family's financial problems. He decided to start his own business and opened a retail shop. He has been operating his business for four years and is the person who pays for the household expenses in the home he shares with his parents. He aspires to having his business offer a good future and a good quality of life. 

He is a friendly person and always has a smile for his customers.

Shawgy wants his business to increase its sales so he can prosper financially and offer his parents a better future, because he is a person who has had to fight against adversity his whole life. 

In order for his business to increase its sales, he needs to buy more products to offer more variety for his customers. Nonetheless, he doesn't have enough capital right now to do it. That is why he requests a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. The loan will allow him to buy basic products such as rice, sugar, flour, beans and soft drinks to offer in his business and thus increase his sales. 

In the future, Shawgy hopes that with the extra income that he will generate, he can offer a better quality of life to his parents and they can prosper financially, so in the future they can have the financial stability they have wished for so much.

loans.use: to buy basic products such as rice, sugar, flour, beans and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Anass

texts.en:
Anass is a 26-year-old single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He opened a mobile phone accessories shop six months ago. He is a computer engineer 

This business is improving and at the same time, competition is increasing. That's why each one must find his specialty and that's what he is doing. 

Anass is a man with very good communication skills who treats his customers in a very attractive and elegant way. He makes special offers all the time to attract new customers and to keep current customers.

To keep up to date with the new technologies, he is requesting a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to add new mobile phones and special accessories to his merchandise. This new stock is attractive enough to increase his income and let him dream of a shining future.

In the future, he hopes to expand his business, open an internet café and get married.

loans.use: to buy new mobile phones and special accessories to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new construction tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new clothes collection for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase added metal supplies and construction tools for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new Bob cat and a truck for his work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional cattle for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to perform needed maintenance on his apartments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a pick up for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase the needed mechanic's tools.

loans.name: Arafat

texts.en:
Arafat is a 29-year-old man. He is single and lives in Taiz, Yemen. His educational background is secondary school only. He has been selling phone accessories for the last three years. He is very experienced in his business and knows well where to buy merchandise for a low price. 

Arafat usually brings his goods in from other cities and buys them from wholesale markets for a low price. Then he resells them for a more profitable price in his home city. He is very friendly and has already gained some permanent clients. His father helps him to bring in new goods from another city such as stereos, cosmetics, and perfumes. 

Due to the current bad situations which Yemen has experienced, his business has had lower profits and fewer clients. 

Arafat has applied for a youth loan of 100,000 Yemeni Rial (YER) from AMB in order to purchase more phone merchandise and stereos, which will increase his sales since this type of product is very popular. 

In the future, he wishes to save some money for his upcoming wedding party.

loans.use: to purchase more phone merchandise and stereos that will increase sales

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is 26 years old. She lives in Taiz, Yemen and characterizes herself as being a very hardworking hairdresser. For some time now, she has worked  in a company selling cosmetics. With the impetus of helping her family with the household income, Amal decided to open a beauty salon that would provide more generalized services related to skin health, facial aesthetics, foot care, even meditation and other services. 

Because she is a professional in her field, she actually has made more profit from customers who prefer to style their hair. 

Due to the current bad situation in Yemen, almost all of her clients left to their villages and didn't have any interest in coming to her business when having weddings, which caused her business to stop.

Now she applied for a youth loan of 100,000 Yemeni Rial (YER) from AMB. This is why she has the hope that a loan will afford her the opportunity to buy personal care products for her business like lotions, creams, shampoo and make-up, among other things, that she hopes will make her customers return. 

In the future, Amal dreams that her business will continue to provide income in order to help her family with the household income, and that way, provide a better quality of life. She also dreams of having a big store where she could hire many girls who are in need of work over there.

loans.use: to buy personal care products like lotions, creams, shampoo and make-up

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is a 35 year old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food stuffs in Yambio, South Sudan for six years. Flora is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase onions and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Kazhal

texts.en:
Kazhal is a 26-year-old, single woman living in Iraq. She has been working hard since a very young age and has gained a lot of experience in how to run a beauty salon well, and how to provide customers with great service, meeting their needs every day.  

The little salon has been in business for 11 years, and Kazhal would like to refresh the store with some new furniture and also buy new massage equipment to provide a new service to her clients. 

Kazhal took a loan of $2,400 from Relief International - Iraq to be able to renew her business.

Kazhal is under 30 and qualifies for a "youth loan."

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for her protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to refresh the store and buy massage equipment.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan, trabaja como administrador financiero en una pastelería de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo requiere para la refacción de habitaciones, pintado y colocado de puertas en su  vivienda para dar más comodidad a su familia.

Juan es casado y tiene tres hijos viven en casa propia en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.

Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Juan works as the financial administrator in a cake shop in the city of La Paz.

He needs the loan to repair rooms, paint, and place doors in his house.  He will do this in order to make his family more comfortable.

Juan is married and has three children.  He lives in his own house in the Alto San Pedro area of the city of La Paz.

This is the second time he has worked with IMPRO, and the first time he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to repair rooms, paint, and place doors in his house.

loans.name: Raylen

texts.en: Raylen works hard to support her family. Raylen is married and has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines. She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF for the maintenance of her motorcycle. Raylen has been in this business for eight years now. In the future, Raylen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 30 year old a married woman with one child who is in school. She has a business of selling food staff in yambio south Sudan for seven months. Victoria is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice for sale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a twenty eight year old man from Suna area of Migori Town, West of Kenya and is married to Akinyi and they have three children at the moment.

John operates a motorcycle transport business locally known as bodaboda, a business he has done for the last two years making a monthly income of KES. 15,000. He has borrowed a first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy spare parts for his motorbike. He will use his profits to repay the loan.

His dream is to ensure his family has the best living standards.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Marion

texts.en: Marion is 33 years old, she is married with two children. She runs a beauty salon to earn a living, she has been in the business for 8 years and has employed two people. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a hair blow dry machine.

loans.use: To buy a hair blow dry machine

loans.name: Gbenonkpo 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONKPO 1 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Valérie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Valérie est âgée de 48 ans et est mariée à un certain Jules. Valérie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés dont un reste à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Valérie mène comme activité depuis six ans environs la vente du riz, de la pâte de maïs et de la bouillie faite à base du blé dans son quartier. Cette activité lui permet de contribuer sans grande difficulté aux besoins de la maison. Valérie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Valérie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO 1, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The GBENONKPO 1 group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the second time that the group is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé, in order to raise the level of its business activity.

Valérie, whose hand is raised in the photograph, is the group's representative. Valérie is 48 years old and married to Jules. She lives with her husband and children. The couple has three children, one of whom remains in their care. All of their children are in school. The various household expenses are covered by the couple.

To manage this, Valérie has run a business selling rice, cornmeal, and wheat porridge in her neighborhood for about six years now. This business allows her to contribute to the needs of her family without great difficulty. Valéire gets her supplies from a market in Benin.

In order to satisfy her customers and increase her turnover and revenue, Valérie, along with the other members of the GBENONKPO 1 grouop, is seeking a second loan from ALIDé. The first loan was correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, corn, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Eric

texts.es:
Eric, es empleado y trabaja como operador en una empresa grafica en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una maquina offset que es de mucha ayuda en el trabajo que el realiza dentro de su empresa.
El es soltero, no tiene hijos y vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona de Pasankeri ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la sexta vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la cuarta vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Eric is an employee, and he works as an operator in a graphics company in the city of La Paz.

He needs the loan to buy an offset machine, which will be of great help in the work he does at his company.

He is single and does not have children.  He lives in his parents’ house in the Pasankeri area in the city of La Paz.

This is the sixth time he has worked with IMPRO, and it is the fourth time he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy an offset machine for printing where he works.

loans.name: Maria Dora

texts.es: Maria Dora tiene 53 años de edad, ella trabaja como secretaria en la alcaldía de la localidad, nos expresa Maria que el salario que devenga no le cubre para realizar las mejoras de su vivienda que con mucho sacrificio la adquirió y que uno de sus sueños es de realizarle las mejoras de su vivienda por falta de dinero no las había realiza. Maria Dora está solicitando crédito para realizar las mejoras lo cual comprar bloque, cemento, cerámica, entre otros materiales de construcción.
texts.en: Maria Dora is 53 years old and she works as a secretary at the local City Hall. Maria tells us that her salary isn’t enough to make renovations to her home, a home she acquired with much sacrifice. One of her dreams is to renovate her home, but without the money she hasn’t been able to do it. Mari Dora is asking for a loan to renovate her home and to buy bricks, cement and ceramic, among other construction materials.

loans.use: buy bricks, cement and ceramic among other construction materials.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a 30-year-old married woman.  She has six children who are all enrolled in school.  Her husband's name is Rai and he works as a driver.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor running water.

Riziki operates a retail shop, selling groceries and household goods.  She has worked in this business for five years.  Her primary customers are her neighbors and passers by. Riziki's other source of income is farming.  She describes her greatest business challenge to be inadequate capital to expand her business and her highest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Riziki will use the loan of 30,000 KES to purchase sugar, milk, maize flour, wheat flour, rice, beans and detergent to stock her store with items to sell.  Riziki aspires to establish a wholesale shop in the future.  She joined Yehu in order to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk, maize flour, wheat flour, rice, beans and detergent  to sell.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 45 years old, married and a mother of four children. For the last two years, she has earned a living by selling natural herbal medicines from which the client earns a monthly profit of KES 12,000.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers, and  she is applying for her first loan, of KES 21,000, to buy additional herbal medicines to sell to her customers. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to help pay her children's school fees. 

Priscilla's goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she would give her family some financial stability.

loans.use: to buy additional herbal medicines to sell to her customers

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana is 26 year old a married woman with three children, two of them are in school.  She has a business of selling charcoal in yambio south Sudan for six years. 
Bibiana is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase charcoal.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Ega

texts.en: Ega is a 60-year-old married woman. She has 8 children and 2 are enrolled in school. Her husband works as a farmer. Ega operates a retail shop and sells her goods in a shop. She's worked in this business for 1 year. Her primary customers are her neighbors and passers by. Ega's other source of income includes farming. She describes her greatest business challenge to be competition from other operators and her highest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Ega will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more stocks of sugar, milk, maize flour, wheat flour, rice, beans, cooking oil and detergents for resale. Ega aspires to establish a wholesale shop in the future. She joined Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of sugar, milk, maize flour, wheat flour, rice, beans, cooking oil and detergents for resale.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Angeles works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns an additional income from her buy and sell of charcoal business. Angeles is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing equipment for her fishing/fish vending business.

Angeles has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
For the last two years Noel has been operating a car wash in Oloitoktok town. He is 26 years old married to Margaret. They have one schooling child.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staff. This will be his first loan. He intends to use the loan amount to expand his car wash business and also venture into farming.

In future, Noel hopes to expand his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to expand his car wash business and also venture in to farming.

loans.name: Elekia

texts.en:
Elekia is a sixty year old man from Suna area of Migori Town, West of Kenya and is married to Caren and they have seven grown up children. 

Elekia is an experienced tailor who has done this business for the last 40 years and makes a monthly income of Kes 15,000. He has borrowed a first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy textile material used for tailoring and dressmaking. He will use his profits to repay his loan.

His dream is to ensure his family has the best living standards.

loans.use: To buy textile materials for dressmaking

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luís, es chef y trabaja independientemente, presta sus servicios en la organización de comidas buffet y atención de todo tipo de acontecimientos en general.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar artículos de cocina, vajilla y todo relacionado a línea blanca para ofrecer sus servicios ya que es el único ingreso que tiene para ayudar a su familia. 

Luís, es soltero  no tiene hijos y vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.


Es la tercera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Luís is a chef, and he works independently.  He lends his services to organizing buffet meals and the responsibilities of all types of general events.

He needs the loan to buy kitchen items, dishes, and everything having to do with the Blanca line (kitchen appliances) in order to offer his services.  This is the only source of income that he has to help his family.

Luís is single and does not have children.  He lives in his parents’ house in the Alto San Pedro area of the city of La Paz.

This is the third time he has worked with IMPRO, and the first time he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy dishes, a blender, and other other items for his chef's business.

loans.name: Edolina

texts.en:
Edolina is 53 years old and a widow with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

For the past fifteen years Edolina has had a tailoring and dressmaking shop in the Philippines. She has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more material for her business.

Edolina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more material for her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 40 years old and has 3 children. Rebecca is married and has 2 children who are in school.

Rebecca is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rebecca has been farming rice for 3 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 57 years old and married with 4 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Josephine has a boarding house business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like wood, nails, etc. for the construction of additional rooms for her boarding house business.

Josephine has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy materials for her boarding house business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 46 years old a business man, he is married to Agnes a farmer. They are blessed with two children aged 15 and 11 years respectively. He has been in a livestock trading business for the past three years with the monthly income of KES. 20,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his fourth loan term with KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. Joseph will use the loan to buy more livestock for trading. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a pickup for transporting the livestock to different markets.

loans.use: to buy more livestock for trading

loans.name: Ronaida

texts.en:
Ronaida is 36 years old and married with 7 children. With 6 children in school, Ronaida works very hard to provide for them.

Ronaida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Ronaida has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, coffee, milk, sardines, noodles, etc.

In the future Ronaida would like to save enough money so she could send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. Virginia is a widow and has a buy and sell of fruits business in the Philippines.

Virginia requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy assorted fruits to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy assorted fruits to sell

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 38 years old and married with 4 children.

Nelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Nelia has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Nelia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is thirty four years old business lady from Bungoma town, Western Kenya and is married to Moses and they have four children aged seven to 12 years.

Mildred operates a brick making business, she has been in this business for the last two years and makes a monthly income of KES. 2,500. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy firewood for baking the bricks. 

Her profits will be channeled to repaying the loan.Her dream is to have a big brick baking business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like firewood for baking bricks to sell.

loans.name: Elevenia

texts.en:
Elevenia is 37 years old and married with 3 children.

Elevenia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Elevenia has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an additional income from farming vegetables.

Elevenia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks to sell at her General Store.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha, se dedica a la venta  de todo tipo de  toallas y tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en la ciudad de El Alto. 
El crédito  lo requiere para diversificar su  mercadería mediante la compra de más toallas, para mejorar sus ventas y así obtener más ingresos para su familia.
La señora Martha es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona de las Lomas ubicada en  la ciudad de La Paz.

Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Martha sells all types of towels.  She has a small sales stand in the city of El Alto.

She needs the loan to diversify her merchandise by purchasing more towels.  She will do this in order to improve her sales and to get more income for her family.

Martha is married and has four children.  She lives in her parents’ house in the Las Lomas area of the city of La Paz.

This is the first time she has worked with IMPRO, and it is the first time she has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more towels of different qualities to sell in her business.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas, 54, is married to Dorka. They live in Migori with their five children aged 13 to 25 years.

For the past twelve years Thomas has operated a retail shop. He earns 10,000 KES a month. He is taking a loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD, his first, which he will use to pay the school fees for his children in high school.

Thomas’ dream is to ensure his children get the best education possible.

loans.use: to pay the school fees for his children in high school.

loans.name: Erdenebayar

texts.en: Erdenebayar is 35 years old and lives with his wife and 2 daughters in Suhbaatar province in eastern Mongolia. His wife works as a shop assistant and 2 daughters study at the secondary school. He has been running clothes retailing business in a shop counter. His sales have been profitable because he brings the supplies from China. Due to the transport expenses, he would like to buy the supplies in a large amount and keep the normal prices for the customers. He is an experienced guy on the clothes retailing business and says that "I want to extend the business  by increasing the sales and income so that I could save more for my family". The total amount he is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to buy more clothes from Erlian at whole sale price.

loans.use: To buy more clothes from Erlian at whole sale price

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger, se dedica a la venta de chamarras deportivas de un club de futbol de la ciudad de La Paz y también al colocado de piercing, especialmente a  jóvenes.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar las chamarras en mayor cantidad y los piercings en infinidad de modelos y de esa forma aumentar sus ganancias para ayudar a su familia.
El es soltero, no tiene hijos y vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona de Sopocachi ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la tercera vez que trabaja junto  IMPRO y la tercera vez con KIVA. Su historial de pagos es impecable.
texts.en:
Roger sells sports jackets for a soccer club in the city of La Paz.  He also does piercings, especially for young people.

He needs the loan to buy the jackets in greater quantity and an infinity of piercing designs.  This way he will increase his income in order to help his family.

He is single and does not have children.  He lives in his parents’ house in the Sopocachi area in the city of La Paz.

This is the third time he has worked with IMPRO, and it is the third time he has worked with Kiva.  His payment history is impeccable.

loans.use: to buy more jackets and different piercing designs for his business of selling jackets and giving piercings.

loans.name: Maritza De La Paz

texts.es:
Maritza, se ha decidido por un nuevo prestamo, con la intension de seguir fortaleciendo y mejorando la atencion de los clientes por medio del negocio, ella quiere comprar como siempre la mercaderia en collares, aretes, pulceras de bisuteria y ademas los accesorios juveniles como llaveros, calcomanias, poster, con ello estara ofreciendo en los centros escolares hoy que ya iniciaron las clases.
Ella considera que por medio de los prestamos ha permanecido en sus ventas.
texts.en: Maritza has decided to ask for a new loan, with the intention of strengthening and improving her attention to her clientele through her business. She’d like to buy more jewelry like necklaces, earrings and bracelets, and accessories for the young, like key chains, decals and posters, which she will be selling at schools since classes have begun. She considers that the loans she has received have kept her in business.

loans.use: buy jewelry like necklaces, earrings, bracelets, key chains, decals and posters.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for more clothes to sell on credit.

loans.name: Abdulkaream

texts.en:
Abdulkaream is a 39-year-old, married man and a father of five children who lives in Taiz,Yemen.  He is a very hard-working and kind person. He has been involved in buying and selling food products over fourteen years. 

He started his business with selling jewels of his wife then he was able to open up a grocery store. He has regular customers because he brings in fresh products. He employed a worker who helps him in his business. 

He’s made the decision to invest in his business by buying merchandise wholesale so that he can have the store well-stocked with a variety of products that will help him to keep his clientele and to attract new customers. So, he is requesting a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to refill his working capital and create additional shelves and displays for products.

In the future, Abdulkaream hopes his family will attain better living conditions as well as educating his children at private schools.

loans.use: to refill his working capital and create additional shelves and displays for products.

loans.name: Hardilita

texts.en:
Hardilita is 35 years old and married with five children. With four children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

For the past three years Hardilita has run a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as biscuits, bread, eggs, etc. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Hardilita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Juana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Juana, necesita invertir un nuevo préstamo en la compra de mariscos frescos su intension es seguir trabajando y fortalecer el negocio,comprara pescado de varias clases, camarones, lagosta,  filetes.
Ella considera que estos prestamos le ayudan a tener disponibilidad economica para hacer inversiones periodicas, ya que este producto facilmente se daña, por lo mismo no puede invertir la totalidad del prestamo de una vez, sino que aprender a realizar periodicamente compras.
texts.en: Juana needs to invest a new loan in the purchase of fresh seafood. Her intention is to continue working and strengthen her business. With the loan, she will buy different types of fish, shrimp, lobster and filets. She considers that these loans help her have disposable income to make periodic investments, as the product is easily perishable. This is why she can’t invest the entire loan at once. She has to learn to make periodic purchases.

loans.use: buy different types of fish, shrimp, lobster and filets.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila, 21, is a single lady who is living with her parents. Since graduated from Junior High School Jamila assisted her parents in generating income by running a kiosk business at her house. Jamila stocks her kiosk with household items i.e., cooking oil, coffee, shampoo, instant noodles, snacks, candies, etc. Moreover, she sells some fresh vegetables such as water spinach, cassava leaves, tomatoes, onion, garlic and betel vine. She displays the vegetables in front of her kiosk. 

Jamila was thinking of improving the business by adding a greater variety of stuff, i.e., sugar, coffee, tea, biscuits, banana, corn, cassava, etc. She also wants to sell fried bananas at her kiosk and distribute them to other kiosks around her village. Therefore she is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,500,000. Jamila really hopes that through the loan she will be able to make her dream came true.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, coffee, tea, biscuits, bananas, corn, cassava, etc. for her kiosk and sell fried bananas  as well

loans.name: Lasiman

texts.en:
Lasiman, a 62-year-old widower is living with his children: Dedi, 31 and Merina, 25; both are working. Lasiman used to work as a diesel engine mechanic for years. With the experience from his previous employer, Lasiman initiated his own business at home. 

He repairs car and motorbike engines. Currently, Lasiman has many orders to repair cars and motorbike as well. The lack of capital to purchase spare part and equipment led him to seek money in order to complete the orders on time.

In fact, his children are willing to provide capital but Lasiman does not want to lean on them. He knew that TLM always assists small entrepreneurs in improving their business. Therefore, Lasiman is requesting a loan from TLM of IDR 5,000,000 to buy a compressor, a spark-plug wrench, a shifting spanner, and an adjustable spanner etc. Lasiman really hopes that TLM will approve his loan application shortly.

loans.use: To purchase a compressor, a spark-plug wrench, a shifting spanner, an adjustable spanner, etc.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a 29-year-old lady and is married to Hendro, a 32-year-old man. They have two children namely Satrio, a 7-year-old elementary school student and Risty, 2 years old. To assist Hendro in meeting their household necessities, Martha runs a broiler business. The business location is separate from her residence. She has been running the business for more than 10 years. Martha usually buys chicks and fodder from the supplier; she needs two weeks to raise the chicks and sell them to the customer.  

Martha intends to buy more chicks to be raised since recently hundreds of chicks died because of disease. She was so sad about the situation but she did not despair. She wants to restart the business. Now she needs capital to do so, therefore she is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 3,000,000. She plans to spend the loan on chicks and fodder. Martha is hoping that her loan application will be approved by TLM soon.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and feed for them.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 26 years old, married and has one child. Since 2008 he has owned a shop in Iraq from which he sells cement and concrete. He has a lot of experience in this field. Ahmad has a good reputation and is well known in his neighborhood.

Ahmad is requesting a 3000 USD loan in order to pay the annual rent on his shop and to make a sliding door. He is aiming for more profits so as to provide his family a better life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent on his shop and to make a sliding door.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz es socia del Banco Comunal Legión, tiene 72 años, es madre de 10 hijos de los cuales solo están a cargo de ella 3, Beatriz es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace mas de 3 años, es casada, y se dedica a la venta de carne, agradece a Finca por que logró hacer su casa, compró sus artefactos para su casa, saco profesionales a sus hijos, le gusta venir a las reuniones por que se distrae y ahorra su dinero, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en su negocio en la compra de ganado para vender su carne.
texts.en: Beatriz is an associate of the Communal Bank “Legión” and a 72-year-old, married, mother of 10 children, of whom 3 currently depend on her. Beatriz has been an associate of FINCA Perú for more than 3 years and is a meat seller. She is grateful to the FINCA because she was able to build her house, buy the appliances and help her children become professionals. She likes going to the meetings because she enjoys herself and saves money. The loan she is requesting is to invest in her business, more specifically, for the purchase of livestock so she can continue selling meat.

loans.use: buy livestock.

loans.name: Kefayah

texts.en:
Kefayah did not wish to have her picture uploaded on the internet thus the man in the photo is Kefayah's husband named Hamzah.

Kefayah is a 30-year-old married woman from Al Aqaba, Jordan and a mother of one child.

Kefayah has a grocery store and is requesting a loan of 800 JD to expand the store and purchase goods.

Kefayah is looking to make new decorations for the store and purchase a refrigerator for the fruit. She also dreams of opening another branch of her store.

loans.use: to expand the store and purchase goods.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 36-year-old man who is supporting a family of five members.

Mohammad is a handy-man who makes crafts from wood using different tools that he has. He owns a workshop in his house and has been working in this field for over 15 years now.

Mohammad has applied for a loan to improve the workshop and buy new machines to make the process of his work easier and safer.

loans.use: to improve the workshop and buy new machines.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 28-year-old business woman who lives in Juba Nimule. She is married and has three children between the ages of 6 and 1 year. Two of them go to school. 

Christine runs a small bar business, She has been in the business for 2 years and she has one employee. Christine heard about Finance Sudan from friends, outreach, and promotions done by the loan officers. She is taking a loan of 700 Sudanese pounds (SDG) to purchase more drinks like beer and sodas. In addition to this business, Christine has house she rents as another source of income, which gives her a little amount every month. 

In 5 years time, Christine hopes for a big bar and restaurant and also a better house that contributes financially to the family. Her major challenges include home expenses and sicknesses. Christine says that she is happy for finance South Sudan’s support, which leads to the growth of their business.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks like beer and sodas.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, 45, is from the Suna area of Migori in western Kenya. He is married to Susan, and they have twelve children.

For the past three years David has run a bodaboda, or a motorcycle transport business. He earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

David is applying for a loan of 20,000 KES, his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use it to buy spare parts for his motorbike and use his profits to repay the loan.

David’s goal is to ensure that he gives his children the best education possible.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorbike.

loans.name: Suhailah

texts.en:
Suhailah, a 35-year-old married lady, is a mother of a boy and a baby girl.

Suhailah established a small beauty salon to improve their living conditions and provide their children with a better life. She has applied for a loan to buy more make-up, new hair dryer, and other tools needed for the salon.

loans.use: to buy more make-up, a new hair dryer, and other tools needed for the salon.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad did not want to appear in the photo for personal reasons, so he asked his son Alaa to replace him instead.

Ahmad is a 49-year-old hard-working man who owns a shop for party supplies rental such as seats, decorations based on the event, etc. His son Alaa who appears in the photo works with him. 

Ahmad has applied for a loan today to get the empty shop next door and expand his own and add special rental tents  to the supplies he provides.

loans.use: to get the empty shop next door  and expand his own and add special rental tents  to the supplies he is providing.

loans.name: Nama

texts.en:
Nama is a 39-year-old housewife who has two sons and two daughters. She has been working for almost five years now selling blankets and clothes at home. She buys them at wholesale prices and sells to neighbors, relatives and friends. 

Nama wants to improve the service she has to increase the income and improve their living conditions, so she has applied for a loan to buy more products and hopes that one day she will be able to open a small shop selling clothes and bridal supplies.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and blankets.

loans.name: Regina Del Carmen

texts.es: Regina del Carmen ya ha tenido crédito con Fundación León 2000, para comprar capital trabajo para el negocio que tiene que el servicio de transporte y mejorar el servicio. Regina actualmente está solicitando financiamiento pero en esta ocasión es para  realizarle a su vivienda algunas remodelaciones lo cual no explica la emprendedora que comprara zinc, perlines, clavos, entre otros materiales para realizar las mejoras de la vivienda.
texts.en: Regina del Carmen has already had loans from Fundación León to have working capital for her business, a transportation service, and to improve her service. Now Regina is applying for financing, but on this occasion it is to complete some remodeling on her house. The entrepreneur (Regina) explains to us that she will buy zinc, purlins, and nails, among other materials, to make improvements in her home.

loans.use: to buy zinc, purlins, and nails, among other materials

loans.name: Diudora

texts.es: Diudora es socia del Banco Comunal Legión, tiene 38 años, es madre de 3 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace mas de 12 años, es casada, fue invitada por su vecina, se dedica a la venta de auto partes de carros, durante el tiempo que esta en Finca ha podido construir su casa, de lo cual esta muy orgullosa, le gustan las capacitaciones por que le ayuda a mejorar en su negocio y para con su familia, el préstamo que solicita ahora lo invertir en su negocio.
texts.en: Diudora is an associate of the Communal Bank Legión and is a married 38-year-old mother of 3 children. She’s been an associate of FINCA Perú for more than 12 years, invited by her neighbor. She sells spare parts. In the time she’s been with FINCA, she’s been able to build her house, something she’s very proud of. She enjoys the training and classes because they help her improve her business and her family life. The loan she is requesting is to invest in her business.

loans.use: buy spare parts for her business.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: Carolina es socia del Banco Comunal Legión, tiene 46 años, es madre de 5 hijos de los cuales 3 están bajo su tutela, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace mas de 11 años, es casada, ella es feriante donde lleva verduras, cereales, gallinas, gracias a Finca logró hacer su casa, hizo crecer su negocio dice que ella vendía antes en el mercado frutas y ahora ya va a las ferias a vender, le gusta Finca por que les da ayuda a las mujeres que lo necesitan con los préstamos que sacan con facilidad y nos enseñan a ahorrar, también le gusta las charlas que les da a las socias que son motivadoras, como distribuir sus ganancias y como invertirlas. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá una parte en pintar su casa y la otra en comprar verdura y cereales para que lleve a la feria.
texts.en: Carolina is an associate of the Communal Bank Legión and is a married 46-year-old mother of 5 children, of whom, 3 are still under her care. She’s been an associate of FINCA Perú for more than 11 years. She sells fruit, cereals and hens at the fairs. Thanks to the FINCA she was able to build her home and grow her business; she used to sell fruit at the market, but now she goes to the fairs to sell. She likes FINCA because they help women in need receive loans without a hassle and teach them how to save. She also likes the talks given by the motivational speakers on how to distribute and invest income. The loan she has requested is, in part, to buy paint to paint her house and to buy vegetables and cereals to take to the fair.

loans.use: buy vegetables and cereals.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a 38-year-old married woman whose husband works as a car mechanic.

Faten has been working for twelve years in a clothing factory as a tailor; she also opened her own tailoring workshop a year ago and works in it after finishing her first shift at the factory.

She has applied for a loan today to register her workshop and expand it and add a special machine for sewing.

loans.use: to register her workshop and expand it and add a special machine for sewing.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 40-year-old married woman from Madaba, Amman, Jordan and a mother of two children.

Maha produces dairy products and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase milk for those dairy products.

Maha is looking to expand her project and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase milk for producing dairy products.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh, a 46-year-old married woman, works at one of the governmental entities. She has two sons and two daughters.

After work she has another business selling painting supplies and doing wall paintings as a decoration artist, like the wall shown in the picture. Now she has applied for a loan to buy more painting supplies to increase the quantity she has.

loans.use: to buy more painting supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do home maintenance.

loans.name: Breakthrough Group

texts.en:
Mwanaidi, who is in her early thirties, is married with four children who go to school. Since 2000 she has been running a food vending business as well as selling khanga and vitenge (types of fabric) door to door. She works from 8:00 p.m. to midnight and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

Mwanaidi is requesting a 4,750,000 TZS loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, her eighth loan with the organization. She will share this loan with her loan group, Breakthrough, which has seventeen members who hold each other accountable for paying back their portions of the loan. Mwanaidi used her previous loan portions to increase her food stocks and to start selling khanga and vitenge. She has paid back all her loans successfully.

Mwanaidi wants to use her loan portion to buy more stocks of food so that she can sell to more people. Her dream is to one day be able to open and own a hotel.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of food so that she can sell to more people.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a forty-seven year-old lady from Kisumu city and is married to Henry.  They have seven children from age 6 to 18 years.

Lorna has operated a fruit business for the last 29 years and makes a monthly income of KES.40,000.  She is taking her third loan from KADET, LTD.  She will use to it buy five sacks of oranges and mangoes.

 She will use her profits to stock her business. Her dream is to become a leading fruit seller in Kisumu town.

loans.use: To buy five sacks of oranges and mangoes.

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, single and lives with seven family members.

Abbass has owned a workshop since 2007, where he repairs, fixes and sells all types of sewing machines. He has sufficient experience because he worked since childhood in this field. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding area.

He is requesting a $2700 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to add more equipment. He is aiming to gain more profits, to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to pay the annual rent and to add more equipment.

loans.name: Naranbaatar

texts.en: Naranbaatar is 35 years old and lives with his wife and 4 kids in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife is a shop assistant. The oldest son became a herder and one daughter is at school.  The younger two are in kindergarten. He started a taxi service 5 years ago and is still running the business for the household income. He drives between the towns. Due to the unpaved roads, the car gets broken down several times a year. To keep the business and earn for the family, he needs to buy some necessary equipment for the car. He is a humble and diligent guy who says that "I need to keep my business activities successful for my family. I would like to raise my children with an ability to finance their education." The total amount he is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT for car equipment.

loans.use: To buy necessary equipment for the car

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 30 year-old married woman with one child. The child is in school. Christine has had a business of selling clothes in Yambio, South Sudan, for five years.
Christina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Maria Candelaria

texts.es:
Maria, sigue siendo comerciadnte de ropa, en esta ocacion esta solicitando un prestamo para surtir el negocio, comprando más mercaderia para mejorar la disponibilidad, esta compra le ayudara para que su negocio crezca, obteniendo camisas, blusas, faldas, ropa interior.
Ella esta consiente que con esta ayuda estara prosperando, pero debe tener una buena responsabilidad de pago.
texts.en: Maria continues to be a clothing merchant. On this occasion she is applying for a loan to stock her business, buying more merchandise to improve availability. This purchase will help her so that her business can grow, by obtaining shirts, blouses, skirts, and underwear. She is aware that she will prosper with this help but that she must show good responsibility in making payments.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, skirts, and underwear

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe es socia del Banco Comunal Legión, tiene 54 años, es madre de 3 hijos, es socia del FINCA Perú desde hace mas de 12 años, es viuda, trabaja vendiendo en el mercado cereales; trae de las ferias gallinas y queso para venderlas en el mercado, gracias a los préstamos que recibe esta educando a sus hijos e invierte en su negocio que le da ganancias para así poder salir adelante con su familia, le gusta asistir a las reuniones de su Banco Comunal por que le enseñan muchas cosas como ahorrar, educar a sus hijos, entre otras, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ganado para revenderlos y sacar su ganancia, también queso y gallinas.
texts.en: Guadalupe is an associate of the Communal Bank Legión and is a widowed, 45-year-old mother of 3 children. She’s been an associate of FINCA Perú for more than 12 years. She sells cereals in the market. Thanks to the loans she has received, she’s educating her children and investing in her business that gives her income to get ahead with her family. She enjoys the meetings at the Communal Bank because she learns a lot, like how to save money and educate your children, among others. The loan she is requesting will be invested in livestock that she will resell and make a profit, also to buy cheese and hens.

loans.use: buy livestock, cheese and hens.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 39-year-old married and father of three children. In 1998, Mahmoud opened his own Aluminum Door & Kitchen factory to improve his own living. His 21 years of experience in this field gave him the trust and support of his customers. Mahmoud is a hardworking man. He has a very good reputation and is liked by almost all of his customers and neighbors. 

Mahmoud applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase his merchandise with necessary aluminum pillars. He is very excited about this loan. He believes it will help him expand his business in a very short period of time, which will positively affect his family's social and financial situations.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with necessary aluminum pillars.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is thirty years old and a married woman with two children (one is in school). She has sold fish in Yambio, South Sudan for two months.

Christina is requesting this loan of 400 SDG through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more fish to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her child.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 36 years old and a mother of two children ages 10 and 14.

Mercy does tailoring to earn a living. She has been in this business for 6 years and has employed two people. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future.

She has applied for 70,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
El señor Vicente esta solicitando un préstamo para empezar la construcción de un cuarto. Al vivir en una casa de interés social son muy pequeñas por lo cual con este proyecto tendrán mayor espacio en la casa ya que cuentan con tres hijos pequeños los cuales necesitan su propio espacio y estar más cómodos.
Don Vicente es originario de Nuevo Laredo al igual que su esposa. El señor Vicente elabora en una escuela desde hace mas de once años e impartiendo clases, y también dando clases particulares y así contar con un mayor ingreso, su esposa la señora Thelma se encarga del cuidado de sus tres hijos pequeños los cuales necesitan mas atención. 
Desean darles una mejor patrimonio y seguro a su tres hijos.
texts.en:
Vicente is requesting a loan to start building a room. They live in social housing, where the houses are small, so with this project, they’ll have more space in their house. They have 3 small children who need more space to be comfortable.
Vicente is from Nuevo Laredo, as is his wife. Vicente has worked in a school for more than 11 years, teaching classes and he also teaches privately to make more money. His wife, Thelma, is in charge of the care of their 3 small children as they need more attention.
They wish to give their 3 children a better future and security.

loans.use: build a room in the back of his house.

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.es:
Doña Olimpia, continua invirtiendo en su negocio, que por largos años, ha venido trabajando, siendo madre soltera de tres hijos, hoy en dia solo una estudia y los otros trabajan, teniendo el apoyo economico.
Su negocio se ha mantenido estable, y con variedad de productos, al obtener, financiamiento en todos estos años. El cual esta sastifecha por el crecimiento. Con su nuevo prestamo, invertira en productos de su negocio en compra de granos basicos, gaseosas, cereales, enlatados, golosinas, siendo productos demandados por sus clientes. Obteniendo mejores resultados de ventas.
texts.en: Doña Olimpia is still investing in her business where she has worked for many years while being a single mother of three children. Currently, only one is studying and the other two are working and have financial support. Her business has remained stable and has offered a variety of products in order to obtain financing throughout the years. She is pleased with the growth of her business. With this new loan she will buy products for her business like basic grains, sodas, cereal, canned goods, and sweets, as these products are most in demand with her customers. She will then achieve better sales.

loans.use: buy basic grains and other products her customers want, in order to increase sales.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio, se decidió a solicitar un nuevo préstamo para la compra de granos básicos (frijoles, arroz, maiz, maicillo) y alimentos para cerdos (concentrado), esta inversión le ayudar para darme mantenimiento a la granja y para mantener la suficiente cantidad de granos básicos para vender.
Él considera que su experiencia con el préstamo fue favorable, ya que ha obtenido mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Rogelio decided to ask for another loan to buy basic grains (beans, rice, corn, and sorghum) and concentrated pig feed. This investment will help him support his farm to maintain a sufficient amount of grains to sell. He believes he has had a positive experience with the loan, as he has obtained more earnings.

loans.use: buy beans, rice, corn, sorghum, and pig feed

loans.name: Foiza

texts.en:
Foiza is a 21-year-old married woman with one child who is not in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Yambio, South Sudan for five months.

Foiza is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es: Gloria Del Carmen es una emprendedora que ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, lo cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable con objetivos en la vida, su mayor sueño es crecer en el negocio que tiene ya que tiene tantas ideas que abierto nuevas líneas productos para ofrecerle a sus clientes variedad. Ella tiene múltiples servicios pero esta vez el crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de cerdos y comprar plátanos, tortillas,frutas para los refrescos.
texts.en: Gloria Del Carmen is an enterprising woman who has been working with Fundación León 2000.  She has proven herself to be a responsible person with goals in life.  Her greatest dream is to grow her business since she has many ideas for new product lines so she can offer her customers variety.  She has multiple lines of business, but this time she will use the loan she is requesting to buy pig as well as bananas, tortillas and fruit for soft drinks.

loans.use: purchase pigs, bananas, tortillas and fruit.

loans.name: Nora Del Carmen

texts.es: Nora Del Carmen tiene 55 años de edad, ella trabaja como conserje en un colegio de la localidad, ya tiene varios años de trabajar en ese puesto. Ella tiene tres hijos que la apoyan económicamente, Nora toda su vida a luchado para sacar a sus hijos adelantes y de tener su propio vivienda donde vivir el mayor sueño de ella es realizarle algunas remodelaciones, ya que la tiene construida con zinc alrededor de la vivienda, por tanto está solicitando financiamiento para realizar con el crédito solicitado comprara bloque, cemento, hierro entre otros materiales de construcción.
texts.en: Nora Del Carmen, aged 55, works as a custodian at a local school and has been in that position for several years. She is the mother of three children who support her financially. Nora has struggled all her life to make her children move forward and be the owner of her home. Her greatest dream is to remodel her home which is built with zinc sheets around it. Therefore she applies for a loan which she will use to buy blocks, cement, iron and other building material.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, iron and other building material.

loans.name: Estilita

texts.es:
Estilita es una madre de familia de 37 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y a sus 04 hijos en el caserío Monteverde Bajo del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona de clima tropical caracterizado por la producción de frutas como el mango y el limón. La zona se encuentra ubicada en la región Piura, a cinco horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.
La actividad que desarrolla la titular es la preparación-venta de chicha y piqueos en su domicilio. Ella atiende los días sábados, domingos y lunes. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral, las cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal son comercializadas en el mercado local. Su esposo es agricultor y también brinda servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en su mototaxi.
Estilita desea mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio (comprar mesas y sillas), pues por estas fechas aumenta la clientela y quiere brindar un buen servicio, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.
Ella ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa en el pasado y ha demostrado ser una cliente bastante responsable y puntual con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Estilita is a 37 year old mother.  She lives with her husband and four children in Caserío Monteverde Bajo in Tambogrande District which has a tropical climate suited for fruit production like mangoes and lemons.  The zone is located in Piura Region five hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Region’s capital.

Her activity is making and selling chicha and snacks at home.  She works Saturdays, Sundays and Mondays.  In addition, she also raises barnyard fowl which she sells in the local market when they reach ideal size and weight.  Her husband is a farmer and also provides passenger and cargo transportation services in his mototaxi.

Estilita wants to improve her business’ infrastructure by purchasing tables and chairs because around this time her clientele increases and she wants to provide good service.  Because of this, she’s decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan that will make it possible for her to reach her objective.  She’s had loans with Edpyme Alternativa in the past and has shown herself to be quite a responsible and punctual client with her payments.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her business, as well as ingredients for food

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
Doña Martha, sigue laborando en el colegio como directora, en donde trabaja con empeño, para el bienestar de la familia, de sus tres hijos una trabaja y dos estudian, cuenta con el apoyo economico de su esposo, siendo de oficio soldador. 
Como planes ha sido el mejoramiento de su casa, en donde con el prestamo anterior logro abanzar bastante el cuarto que comenzo y ahora comprara laminas de zinc, perlines, soldadura para poner techo, y compra de puerta,  ventana. El cual se siente sastifecha al poder terminar la obra, que sera de gran utilidad para la comodidad de sus hijos. haciendose a corto plazo, atraves del financiamiento.
texts.en:
Martha continues working as a school principal, a job she carries out with commitment.  She works for the well-being of her family.  She has three children.  One works and two are in school.  Martha has the financial support of her husband who is a welder by trade.

Martha's plans include improving her home.  She used her previous loan to make quite a lot of progress with a room that she had started.  She will now buy sheets of metal, beams and welding materials to install a roof, door and windows.  She feels happy that she will be able to finish the work as it will help make her children more comfortable.  She will carry out the work in the short term through this loan.

loans.use: to buy sheets of metal, beams and welding materials, to install a roof and doors

loans.name: Maura Cecilia

texts.es: Maura Cecilia  es clienta activa de Fundación León 2000, ya tiene varios ciclos trabajando con crédito anterior que se le otorgo, ella lo invirtió en el negocio en la compra de variedad de producto para la pulpería su clientes aumentaron y su productos de igual manera ya que la atención que le brinda a sus clientes es muy bueno que la visitan frecuentemente. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de granos básicos, aceite, jabones, detergente, cepillo de diente, verduras, en otros productos.
texts.en: Maura Cecilia is a client of Fundación León 2000 who has been through several loan cycles already.  She invested the previous loan that she was given in her business.  She bought a variety of products for her grocery store.  Her number of customers grew, as did her products.  The customer service she provides is very good and her customers visit her frequently.  She is currently requesting a loan to buy basic grains, oil, soap, detergent, toothbrushes, vegetables and other products.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil, soap, detergent, toothbrushes, vegetables and other products

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: En la comunidad de Auquimarca, vive Soledad, una mujer sencilla de 22 años que conformó su familia junto a su esposo, con quien tienen 2 pequeños hijos a los que cuidan en su casa propia.
