He works hard to improve his business in order to provide his family with good and healthy living conditions.

loans.use: To buy tools necessary for his business, in addition to doing renovations and improvements of his work space

loans.name: Johnny

texts.es:
Johnny vive en una comunidad llamada desamparados, en la provincia de San Jose, capital de Costa Rica. En esta zona cuenta con una amplia gama de hoteles y le ofrece al turista museos, restaurantes, parques, volcanes centros de conferencias, modernos centros comerciales, cines, teatros, galerías y mucha y variada diversión nocturna. Dentro de las principales atracciones culturales se encuentra el Teatro Nacional, situado en la Plaza de la Cultura e inaugurado en 1897, el Museo del Oro, el Museo de Arte y Diseño Contemporáneo y el Museo de los Niños. Algunas de las más famosas fiestas y celebraciones de la provincia de San José son las fiestas populares de fin y principio de cada año, el Festival de La Luz, en el mes de diciembre y la exposición nacional de orquídeas, en el mes de marzo.
Desde hace unos meses atrás que su automóvil el cual es su medio de transporte para su trabajo, ha estado presentando algunas fallas y también ha llegado la entrada al nuevo curso escolar de sus hijos.  Está un poco preocupado ya que se le dificulta solucionar estas dos situaciones, porque no tiene suficientes ingresos económicos y quiere brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Es por esto que Johnny está solicitando el monto de 500,000.00 (quinientos mil colones), para poder arreglar su automóvil y comprar los útiles escolares de sus hijos, para asi no tener problemas en su lugar de trabajo y darle la oportunidad a sus hijos de continuar superándose y llegan a ser grandes profesionales.
Johnny es miembro de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Rincón Grande S.A, este será su segundo  préstamo razón por la cual está  muy agradecida por las oportunidades  de acceso al crédito que esta le brinda y poder llevar a cabo sus proyectos de vida.
texts.en:
Johnny lives in a community called Desamparados in the province of San José, the capital of Costa Rica.  In this region, there is a wide range of hotels and it offers to the tourist: museums, restaurants, parks, volcanos, conference centers, modern malls and shops, cinemas, theaters, galleries and a lively and varied night life.  Among the main cultural attractions are the National Theater, located in the Plaza de la Cultura and inaugurated in 1897, the Gold Museum, The Museum of Contemporary Art and Design and the Children's Museum.  Some of the most famous fiestas and celebrations in the province of San José are the popular fiestas at the end and the beginning of each year, the Festival of the Light in the month of December and the national orchid exposition in the month of March.

Since a few months ago, his automobile, which is his mode of transportation for his job, has been presenting some failures and also, the beginning of the new school year has arrived for his children.  He is a little bit worried since it is difficult to solve both situations, because he doesn't have sufficient economic income and he wants to offer a better quality of life to his family.

It is for this reason that Johnny is requesting the amount of 500,000.00 colones in order to be able to fix his automobile and purchase school supplies for his children, so that he won't have problems in his work place and he can give his children the opportunity to continue bettering themselves and become great professionals.

Johnny is a member of the Large Corner S.A. Common Credit business.  This will be his second loan, for which he is very grateful for the opportunities to access credit that have been offered to him, so that he can finish his life projects.

loans.use: to fix his automobile and to purchase school supplies for his children.

loans.name: Kingi

texts.en:
Kingi is a 52-year-old married man. He has 11 children and all are enrolled in school. His wife's name is Nyamvula and she works as a domestic assistant.   

Kingi operates a vegetable grocery and sells his goods from home. He has worked in this business for 1 year. His primary customers are his neighbors and passers-by. Kingi's other source of income includes farming.  He describes his greatest business challenge to be lack of enough capital to expand his business. His highest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Kingi will use the KES 10,000 loan to purchase more stocks of maize, cabbages, spinach, carrots, tomatoes and onions for resale. Kingi aspires to establish a retail shop in the future. He joined Yehu to access funds to expand his business.

loans.use: buy vegetables

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a thirty-three-year-old business lady from Bungoma town, Western Kenya.  She is a single mother of two children, aged three and five years.

Esther operates a salon.  She has been in this business for the last three years and makes a monthly income of KES 12,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy hair chemicals and other items like shampoos, hair oils and combs for the salon. Her profits will be channeled into clearing the loan and also expanding the business.

Her dream is to provide for her children’s basic needs.

loans.use: buy salon supplies

loans.name: Namai

texts.en:
Namai is a 29-year-old a single woman with four children, all of them are in school.  She has been running a business selling clothes in Yambio, South Sudan for four year.

Namai is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy clothes

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah live in the Airport community.  She is 39 years old, married and has four children between 9 and 18 years old. She stopped her education in the 7th grade.  For the past twelve years she has been selling charcoal and palm oil in her community.   Sarah says that she spend most of her time with her business, since it helps to sustain her family.  She started this business with money given to her by her mother.  At the time, her husband was not working.  Currently her husband works as carpenter.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business.  Her plans are to build a house and buy a car.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Perez

texts.en:
Perez is a thirty-year-old single mother of three children, aged between 6 and 13 years.

Perez operates a grocery store where she sells a variety of items, a business she has done for the last two years.  She makes a monthly income of KES 10,000.  She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy stocks of maize, beans, onions, tomatoes and eggs for resale.  Her profits will be used to educate and feed her children.  Her dream is to own a big grocery shop.

loans.use: buy food items

loans.name: Mwavadu

texts.en:
Mwavadu is a 35-year-old married man. He has 4 children and 1 is enrolled in school.  

Mwavadu operates a cereals selling business and sells his goods from home. He has worked in this business for 6 years. His primary customers are his neighbors and passers-by. Mwavadu's other source of income includes farming. He describes his greatest business challenge to be lack of enough capital to expand his business. His highest monthly expense is food for his family. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mwavadu will use the KES 15,000 loan to purchase more stocks of cereals like maize and beans for resale. Mwavadu aspires to establish a retail shop in the future. He joined Yehu to access funds to expand his business.

loans.use: buy cereal grains

loans.name: Shakhsade

texts.en:
Shakhsade is 57 years old. She lives in the village Karajala with her family: 32-year-old son, daughter in law, and three grandchildren (9, 7 and 3 years old). Shakhsade is leading the farming activities of the family, which is the main source of income for them. She has a plot of the land, part of which is used for green growing during the whole year. She sells harvested greens in Tbilisi (the capital city of the country). Her son is a worker in the village. Total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Laris.

This year, Shakhsade decided to cultivate the whole plot and sow more greens. With the requested credit, she will rent a tractor for land cultivation and purchase seeds of greens. She will get more harvest and the family’s income from sales will increase. Shakhsade will be able to purchase more household goods to improve the family living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation and purchase seeds of greens

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: Luis de 36 años de edad y residente en el municipio de Soledad, donde habita con su esposa y su hijo de 3 años; él se dedica a la comercialización de medicamentos, perfumería y cosméticos, negocio que inició desde hace 5 años,  cuando  decidió generar  ingresos independientes, después de trabajar en una perfumería desde hace 10 años, en la cual adquirió su mayor experiencia respecto a estos productos. El inició arrendando un local muy cerca a su vivienda, espacio comercial donde ha construido una excelente clientela, con la que ha crecido su negocio y al cual le ha agregado los servicios de fotocopiaje  y venta de minutos a celulares. Su meta mas adelante es comprar su propia vivienda para adecuar su establecimiento comercial. Como su clientela ha crecido hay temporadas en las cuales su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para responder a la demanda, especialmente en el primer trimestre del año en el que requiere dinero para invertir en compras de medicinas en mayor volumen. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, para hacer esta inversión, aprovechando que la temporada genera la probabilidad de que su inversión tenga mucho éxito.
texts.en:
Luis, 36, lives in the town of Soledad with his wife and 3 year old son. He sells medicines, perfumes and cosmetics - a business that he started 5 years ago when he decided to make an independent income. He had been working in a perfume shop for 10 years, which is where he got most of his experience with these products. He began renting a commercial space close to his house, and he has created a strong customer base that has helped him grow his business and add copying services and cell phone minute sales. His goal down the road is to buy his own house where he can install his store. 

Since his customer base has grown, there are some seasons when he doesn't have enough capital to meet demand, especially in the first third of the year when he needs money to buy medicines in bulk. This is why he's accessing a Kiva loan, to make this investment and take advantage of the season, making it more probable that his investment will be successful.

loans.use: to buy medicines in bulk.

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en:
Rosaline is a thirty-four-year old lady from Kisumu City.  She is married to Martin and they have three children, aged eight to thirteen years.

Rosaline operates a cereal selling business, a business she has run for the last three years which makes a monthly income of KES 5,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy rice, peas, beans and other cereals.  Her profits will be used to educate and feed her children.    Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: buy cereal grains

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice is a 34-year-old married woman with no child.  She has been running a food stall business in Yambio, South Sudan for three years.  Joice is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions and beans.  She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: buy onions and beans

loans.name: Batnasan

texts.en: Batnasan is 26 years old and lives with his mother in his own ger in Uvurhangai province in Mongolia. He has been running a business repairing mobile phones since 2009. He manages his business well and makes the repairs from a well-known mobile phone market, which is the only one market in town. He already has regular customers and now he plans to extend his business by getting a new table, seats and other equipment for the counter. He is a diligent man who says that "I would like to extend my business activity when I am young before I get married. By getting this loan, the customers would be satisfied with the service and the income would rise."  The total amount he is requesting is 450,000 MNT to buy phone equipment and other implements for his work place.

loans.use: buy phone equipment and improve his shop

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a thirty-five-year-old lady from Kisumu City.  She is married to Dickson and they have three children, aged six to fourteen years.

Rose operates a food kiosk selling meals, a business she has done for the last three years.  She makes a monthly income of KES 5,000.  She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy foodstuff such as maize, beans, sugar and cooking flour. She will use her profits to educate her children.  Her dream is to own a hotel in Kisumu town.

loans.use: buy foodstuff

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 41-year-old married man, who has been working as a taxi driver for 11 years. In 2006, Ali was able to buy an old car and work on it.
It is his only source of income. That's why he has to take good care of it.
To do so, Ali applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to change his car's engine to keep it in good shape. This is Ali's third cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. All his previous loans were invested in improving his car's condition. He was a borrower in good standing as well.
Ali dreams of buying a new car in the future to avoid further mechanical problems.

loans.use: To change his car's engine

loans.name: Decontee

texts.en: Decontee is 23 years old and lives in the Airport Community. She is married with a 5-year-old child who lives at home and attends school. For the past five years, she has been selling used clothes. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She is appreciative of her business which keeps her saving every day. Her plan is to build a house. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business, to enable her to expand her business and get more profit for savings.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Luisa Etelvina

texts.es:
Luisa es una señora de 50 años, ella no tiene hijos y básicamente se enfoca en sí misma y mejorar su calidad de vida por medio de su trabajo. Ella disfruta mucho de estar acompañada por un buen libro literario, también disfruta comer de un riquísimo “Ají de Gallina”, ella nos comenta que si por ella fuera, comería este delicioso platillo todos los días. 

A Luisa le hubiese gustado poder estudiar contabilidad, pero por diversas circunstancias no pudo cumplir este sueño que anhelaba, actualmente tiene un negocio en donde realiza algunas cosas referentes a la contabilidad y administración, Luisa creó una pequeña bodega en donde se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, cervezas, bebidas gasificadas y balones de gas para el consumo doméstico. Luisa sabe que este trabajo demanda mucha disciplina es por esto que trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, tiempo en el que atiende a aproximadamente 25 persona, ella se dedica a convertirlos en sus clientes tratándolos bien y satisfaciendo las necesidades de compra que estos tengan.

Luisa sabe que su negocio tiene mucho éxito por la variedad de productos que ofrece, por ahora ella quiere comprar muchos más productos, los mismos que son solicitados por sus clientes, es por esto que desea que los prestatarios Kiva la apoyen y de esta forma ella pueda comprar mercadería (Abarrotes, Cerveza y Gas Doméstico) al por mayor lo que necesita y así maximizar su margen de ganancia, dinero que luego le permitirá adquirir otros productos en general y a consecuencia de esto, logrará mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luisa, 50, has no children and is focused on herself and improving her quality of life through her work. She enjoys reading good literature and also eating a delicious plate of aji de gallina. She tells us that if it were up to her, she'd eat it every day.

Luisa would have liked to study accounting, but for various reasons she wasn't able to fulfill this desire. Now she has a business where she does a few things related to accounting and administration. She started a small store where she sells groceries, beer, sodas and propane tanks. She knows that this job requires a lot of discipline and that's why she works from 7am to 10pm, during which she attends around 25 people. She is committed to turning them into paying customers, treating them well and satisfying their need for products. 

Luisa knows that her business is successful because of the variety of products she offers. For that reason, she wants to buy a lot more products that her customers are requesting. She needs the Kiva lenders to support her in this so that she can buy needed merchandise (groceries, beer and propane) in bulk and maximize her profit margin. The savings will allow her to get new products and, as a result, improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy groceries, beer and propane.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 28 years old and lives in the community of Airport. She is married and has three children, aged 4 to 12, all of whom are currently in school and live at home. Comfort has been selling palm oil at the market for the past nineteen years. She enjoys the way customers respond to her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. Her plan is to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Rusudan

texts.en:
Rusudan is 54 years old. She is a widow and lives with her 34-year-old son in Gardabani District, East Georgia. One source of income for the family is agriculture. They have 0.5 hectares of land, on which they grow maize that is sold locally. They also have a small dairy farm with 3 milk cows. Rusudan makes cheese and sells, on average, 40 kg of this product in the village. Rusudan’s son is a worker at a local company. The family's total average monthly income is 1000 Georgian laris (GEL).

Rusudan requested credit to expand the family's cattle shed. With a bigger cattle shed, Rusudan will be able to keep more milk cows on the farm, which will increase the family’s income and enable them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials to expand her cattle shed

loans.name: Jorge Martin

texts.es:
Jorge es un joven de apenas 22 años que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, le gusta mucho practicar deporte y disfruta mucho de comer “Tallerinas con Papa a la Huancaína”. Jorge ha podido estudiar hasta el 5º de secundaria, lamentablemente le hubiese gustado estudiar Ingeniería Civil pero por motivos personales sus padres pudieron solventarle sus gastos, pero este motivo no lo detuvo y es por esto que continuo luchando hasta tener un negocio propio, es por ello que actualmente se encarga de realizar el servicio de transporte público a partir de las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, este gran esfuerzo lo hace para poder ayudarse a sí mismo y comprarse otra nueva moto taxi propia.

El es un joven que constantemente quiere salir adelante, es por este motivo que ahora tiene nuevas metas y una de ellas es poder comprarse una nueva moto taxi, con la que brindara un mejor servicio y ya no tendrá que visitar frecuentemente a técnicos automotrices para darle solución a su problema.

Por el momento el desea poder realizar algunas mejoras a su moto taxi, es decir quiere reforzarla para poder salir a trabajar tranquilo, sabiendo que no tendrá ninguna dificultad en el transcurso del día. Con estos nuevos ingresos desea incrementar sus ahorros y emplearlos en las nuevas metas que pueda plantearle en el transcurso del tiempo.
texts.en:
Jorge is a young man, barely 22, who is very eager to get ahead. He likes sports, and really enjoys eating "Tallarines con Papas a la Huancaína" (Noodles with Huancayo-style Potatoes).

Jorge was able to go to school until the fifth year of secondary. He would have liked to study civil engineering, but unfortunately, for personal reasons, his parents couldn't pay his expenses. But this didn't stop him, and is why he kept struggling until he had his own business. This is why he is currently responsible for providing public transportation service, from 8:00 in the morning until 10:00 at night.

He makes this great effort in order to help himself, and to buy himself another new mototaxi. He is a young man who constantly wants to move forward in his life. It is for this reason that he now has new goals, and one of these is to be able to buy himself a new mototaxi, with which he will offer better service, and will no longer have to visit auto mechanics frequently to solve a problem. 

For now he wishes to carry out a few improvements to his moto taxi, which is to say, he wants to recondition it, so that he can go to work without worrying, knowing that he will have no difficulty during the course of the day. 

With this new income, he wishes to increase his savings, and use them for new goals that may consider as time goes by.

loans.use: To recondition his mototaxi.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is 38 years old. She lives in a small village in East Georgia with her family: her husband Emzar and three children, aged 18, 8, and 7. All three children go to school. Agriculture is the family's main source of income. They have 2 milk cows and sell homemade cheese and milk. Emzar works as a herdsman in the village. The family's total average monthly income is 500 Georgian laris (GEL).

Khatuna requested credit to purchase 2 calves. She will raise them and then sell them in late spring for a higher price, which will provide the family with additional income. Khatuna plans to use the additional income to finance her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Azim

texts.ru: Азим трудолюбивый и добрый человек. Он женат и ответственный отец двоих детей. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Его родители живут с ними. Ему очень интересно заниматься скотоводством и более 5 лет он занимается этим бизнесом и успешно продолжает. Имеет корма в запасе, также имеет хорошие условия по уходу за ними. Азим хотел бы получить займ в размере 4000 Сомони для покупки крупного рогатого скота.
texts.en: Azim is a hardworking and kind man.  He is married and the responsible father of two children.  His wife is a homemaker.  His parents live with the family.  Azim has a strong interest in animal-husbandry and has been involved in this business for more than 5 years.  He is pursuing this activity successfully.  He has good supplies of animal feed as well as the conditions necessary to take good care of his livestock.  Azim would like to receive a loan of 4,000 somoni to purchase cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, is married, and has two children, one of whom is working. Kassem has owned a women’s clothing store since 2010. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knowledge of their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

Kassem is requesting a loan of $1800 in order to make an advertising light box and showcases for his store. He aims to increase his profits so he will have the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: make an advertising light box and showcases for his store.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 27 years old, married and a mother of one. She is employed and earns a salary of 40,000 shillings per month. 

This is Irene’s first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the loan to upgrade her living standards. She plans to purchase a fridge and a television. She hopes to achieve her dream of investing in real estate in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge and a television.

loans.name: Los Amigasos Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento Los Amigasos en su primer ciclo conformado por 8 integrantes de los cuales 7 son mujeres y 1 varón viven la localidad de el Torno en la comunidad Espejos  todos cuentan con una actividad, venta. De comida, cosméticos, servicios.
La Gabriela actualmente toma el cargo de presidenta del banco de dedica a la venta de comida rápida se dedica a esta actividad hace un año,  el préstamo será destinado a aumentar su capital de trabajo comprando insumos para la elaboración de comida como papa, aceite, carne,  no esta casada pero vive con el  señor Eduardo y tiene un hijo que esta de 5 meses su esposo presta el servicio de albañilería  trabaja desde tempranas horas de la mañana los señores están muy agradecidos con nuestra entidad por haber confiado en ellos y brindarles un apoyo para poder crecer en su negocios y actividades.
texts.en:
The "Los Amigasos" communal bank is in its first loan cycle, and is made up of eight members; seven of whom are women and one a man. They live in  Torno, in the community of Espejos. They all have businesses: selling food, selling cosmetics, providing services. 

Currently, Gabriela is in the position of president of the communal bank. She sells fast food, and has been in this business for a year. 

The loan will be earmarked for increasing her working capital, through purchasing cooking supplies such as potatoes, cooking oil, and meat. She isn't married, but lives with Eduardo and has a 5-month-old child. Her husband is a bricklayer, and works from the early hours of the morning. 

The members are very grateful to our institution for having trusted them, and provided them support to be able to prosper in their businesses and activities.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making hamburgers.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, is single, and lives with two family members, one of whom is working. In 2011, Ali opened his own barber shop, where he offers shaving and massage services. He has sufficient experience and a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area, so there are a good number of customers passing by.

Ali is requesting a loan of $3000 to pay for the annual rent on his shop, make an aluminum showcase, and buy a machine for massaging. He aims to increase his profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: pay the annual rent for his shop, make an aluminum showcase, and buy a machine for massaging.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Due to cultural issues, Zeinab rejected having her picture uploaded on the internet so the man in the photo is Zeinab's son.

Zeinab is a 60-year-old married woman from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan and a mother of two children.

Zeinab is a Jordanian micro-entrepreneur who has a home-based project helping her to provide a good life for her family. Zeinab is requesting a loan of 1,000 JD to purchase home accessories and products for trading purposes.

Zeinab is looking to purchase a bus to distribute her products and purchase a home for the family.

loans.use: to purchase home accessories and products to sell

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en: Sameera is a 53-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children. Sameera is looking to improve her family's living conditions. Thus, she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to do maintenance on her home.

loans.use: to do home maintenance

loans.name: Drissa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Drissa est un jeune célibataire de 27 ans, qui vit dans une famille traditionnelle à Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  Drissa après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès,  s’est initié  il y a plus de trois ans au domaine du commerce notamment la vente d’articles divers (huile alimentaire, sel, spaghetti, savon etc.) dont il dispose une place au sein du nouveau marché avec une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes de ménage. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ trois ans, il est à son quatrième prêt individuel. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
 Ainsi, avec ce quatrième prêt, il compte acheter, 7 sacs de sel, 6 futs d’huile alimentaire, 5 cartons de maggie, 5 cartons de spaghetti, 4 cartons de savons, 2 carton de sardine et 4 cartons de concentrée tomate. Il s'approvisionne auprès de commerçants grossistes de place avant de les revendre en détail, au  comptant et à crédit.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 220 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Drissa, age 27, is unmarried and lives in a traditional family in Sikasso (Third Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali). After trying several businesses without success, he started selling various products (cooking oil, salt, spaghetti, soaps, etc.).

He has a spot at the new market, and his clientele is mainly made up of housekeepers. He is very much in demand from customers, thanks to the quality of his products.

About three years ago, he decided to join Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet an ever-increasing customer demand. He's seeking his fourth personal loan. Previous loans were repaid without problems.

With this fourth loan, he intends to buy seven bags of salt, six cans of cooking oil, five boxes of "Maggi" bouillon cubes, five boxes of spaghetti, four boxes of soaps, two boxes of sardines, and four boxes of tomato concentrate.

He gets his supplies from wholesalers in the city, and sells retail, for cash and on credit. Thanks to this loan, he intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 220'000 (ca US$ 440), to be used mainly to help cover the family's expenses and pay the interests of the loan. He will reinvest the remainder in his business.

loans.use: to buy salt, cooking oil, bouillon cubes, spaghetti, soaps, sardines, and tomato concentrate

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Madame Mariam est née vers Novembre 1977 à Kiffosso sous-préfecture de Yorosso (cercle de Koutiala). Mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle réside avec ses deux enfants chez son père à Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Mariam mène il y a environ dix ans  les activités d’achat et de vente des pagnes wax, draps de lits, chaussures, tissus brodés, balaies, etc. Elle mène son activité à son domicile et de façon ambulante dans la ville de Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant cinq ans. Après  plusieurs prêt solidaires dans une association des femmes de sa localité, elle est à son  troisième prêt individuel avec lequel elle est compte acheter, 10 pièces de pagne wax, 20 paires de chaussures de qualités différentes, 5 complets de tissus brodés et des balaies. Elle achète ses marchandises sur place et à Bobo Dioulasso (au Burkina Faso) avant de les revendre en détail de façon ambulante, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 185 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mariam was born around November 1977 in the Kiffosso district of Yorosso (cercle de Koutiala). Married and the mother of two children, she lives with her two children at her father's house in Sikasso (the third largest administrative region of the republic of Mali). For approximately the last ten years, Mariam has bought and sold 'pagnes' (traditional printed cloths), bedsheets, shoes, embroidered materials, brooms, etc. She conducts this trade from home and on a mobile basis in the town of Sikasso, where she is much sought after by her customers for the quality of her products. To meet the needs of her ever growing customer base, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso five years ago. Following several group loans with an association of women from her area, she is now taking her third personal loan, with which she plans to purchase 10 traditional outfits, 20 pairs of shoes of various quality, 5 embroidered full length outfits and some brooms.
She buys her goods locally, and also in Bobo Dioulasso (in Burkina Faso). Accepting cash or credit, she then sells them retail, by going door-to-door, to a customer base composed essentially of women. 

All her previous loans have been fully repaid. With this loan she anticipates a monthly profit of 185,000 CFA which will be used essentially to help cover family expenses, to pay the loan interest, and to invest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase various articles

loans.name: Mame Boubou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mame Boubou vit  au Sénégal  et est âgé de 38 ans. Il est marié et s’active dans le secteur de la couture. Il est tailleur depuis plus de 10 ans. Il a choisi cette activité par passion. Ce qui l’intéresse  surtout dans son activité ce sont les beaux habits  qu’il  confectionne, ainsi que les bénéfices qui lui sont générés. Il est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis novembre 2004.  Il a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit antérieur. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’aménagement  de  sa  chambre. Ce financement lui permettra  d’améliorer le cadre de vie de son épouse.
texts.en: Mame Boubou lives in Sénégal and is 38 years old. He is married and works in the tailoring industry. He has been a tailor for more than 10 years, an activity he chose out of passion. What he enjoys above all about his profession are the wonderful suits he creates, as well as the profits he generates. He has been a member of one of the branches of U-IMCEC since November 2004. He has already benefited from a previous loan. He is seeking a loan of 300,000frs in order to refurbish his bedroom. The funds will allow him to improve his wife's living environment.

loans.use: to refurbish his marital bedroom

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica de 41 años vive con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 6 a 15 años, ella tiene un negocio familiar desde hace 14 años, en el que trabaja con su cónyuge (como muestra la fotografia),en la  preparación y venta de arroz de pollo, las cuales comercializan utilizando un triciclo cuando este último recorre a diario una ruta de ventas y también tienen un puesto estacionario frente al puesto de salud del barrio. Con sus ingresos han logrado hacerle arreglos a su vivienda y satisfacer las necesidades de educación de sus 4 hijos.  Con su negocio Mónica y su esposo cubres  sus costos y responden a los gastos familiares; ellos   tienen los activos fijos indispensables para realizar la actividad, y manejan un capital de trabajo pequeño, acorde a las características de su negocio, así como su rotación de cartera que se muestra ágil y con ello logran hacer sus compras en pequeñas cantidades, por eso   sus costos productivos son superiores a los de su competencia,  porque su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para comprar  materias primas en mayor volumen, esta es la razón por la cual Mónica acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprara aceite, arroz, pollo y verduras en un alto volumen, su éxito radica en que  con ello disminuiría los costos de producción y respondería si mismo con un competitivo precio de venta, para fidelizar sus clientes.
texts.en: Mónica, 41, lives with her husband and four children, aged 6 to 15.  For 14 years she and her husband (shown in the photograph) have been running a family business making and selling chicken and rice.  Her husband uses a tricycle cart for his daily sales route and they also have a stall across from the neighborhood health center.  With their income they have been able to renovate their house and give their four children an education.  Mónica and her husband are able to cover household costs with their business.  They have the necessary fixed assets to conduct business and they handle a small amount of working capital, in accordance with the nature of the business.  Their order turnaround is quite fast so they can make small purchases.  But their production costs are higher than their competitors because they do not have enough capital to buy bulk raw materials.  This is why Mónica has requested a Credikiva loan, her first through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which she will use to buy bulk oil, rice, chicken and vegetables.  Success will be based on being able to reduce production costs and offer a competitive sales price aimed at customer loyalty.

loans.use: To buy bulk oil, rice, chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: William

texts.es: William  de 38 años de edad, residente en el municipio de Galapa se dedica a la elaboración de calzado para damas, caballeros y niños, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 4 años, en su propia casa , la que con sus esfuerzos  han construido; su oficio lo aprendió de un tío, quien desde muy joven lo llevaba al taller donde él trabajaba; allí se inició como ayudante y mas tarde, cuando quiso ser independiente, compro una maquina plana e inicio su negocio;  tiene un punto de exhibición en un lugar céntrico del municipio,  donde su esposa tiene un local alquilado y ofrece servicio de llamadas, fotocopias, recargas de celulares etc, mientras el taller de calzado funciona en su residencia; complementariamente  los fines de semana venden comidas rápidas. Su esposa le aporta gran parte de los gastos del hogar y cubre sus propias obligaciones; con sus ventas responde a sus gastos de funcionamiento y familiares y con los ingresos adicionales responde a obligaciones que eventualmente se hacen  y también hace su compra. William en su negocio maneja un buen stock de productos y materias primas en calzados casuales.   Sus cuentas por cobrar rotan con agilidad y su margen de rentabilidad es adecuado para este tipo de negocio.  En la actualidad acude a su primer credikiva, también primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, este tiene el objetivo de comprar materias primas para la producción de calzado colegial y para damas que es el más apetecido en la temporada de ingreso a clases. William espera salir con nuevos diseños colegiales y hacer su mejor venta en esta época, pero su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para sus expectativas, esto justifica su financiamiento, el que planea sea exitoso, porque en su experiencia en los primeros meses del año incrementa sus ingresos a partir del negocio de su calzado colegial.
texts.en: William, 38, lives in the municipality of Galapa nd he makes women's, men's and children's shoes for a living.  He lives with his wife and 4-year-old son in their own house which they have built through hard work.  He learned his trade from an uncle who used to take him to work with him when he was a little boy.  He began working as an assistant, then decided to become independent and bought an overlock sewing machine to start his business.  He has a display point in the center of town where his wife has rented a space to offer telephone, photocopying and cell phone recharge services.  The shoe workshop is set up in his home.  Also, on weekends they sell fast food.  His wife covers a large part of the household expenses and takes care of her obligations.  With her sales, she covers operating costs and family expenses, and the additional income is for any extra payments or to make purchases.  William handles a significant stock of products and raw materials for casual shoes.  His accounts receivable have a short turnaround time and his profit margin is adequate for this type of business.  Currently he is requesting a Credikiva loan, his first through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, in an aim to buy raw materials to make school shoes and women's shoes for the upcoming school season.  William wants to produce new school designs and increase his sales volume this season but he did not have the working capital to meet his goals and therefore requested the loan.  He is confident his plans will be successful because experience shows that in the first months of the year there is an increase in school shoes sales.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make women's and school shoes.

loans.name: Carminia Ester

texts.es: Carminia de 55 años vive al sur occidente de la ciudad y tiene una frutera y una miscelánea, con la cual ha logrado ingresos importantes para el sostenimiento de su hogar en el que  tiene 4 hijos, hoy en las edades de 25 a 38 años de edad. Ella nació en Santa Marta, la ciudad más antigua de Colombia y la segunda más antigua de Sudamérica; desde allí, a sus 11 años de edad,  llegó  a Barranquilla y se organizó en familia a los 17 años, época en la cual nació su primer hijo y en la que ella para apoyar el bienestar de su familia, se dedicó a genera ingresos a través de la venta de verduras desde su hogar;  gradualmente su negocio empezó a crecer y posteriormente integró a el la venta de mercancía variada; actualmente sus compras las hace de contado y sus ventas a crédito y también de contado;  Carminia está aplicando a su primer credikiva, también primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará útiles escolares y frutas de la temporada,  como peras, manzanas y uvas, su ubicación espacial es su gran fortaleza, la que diariamente convierte en oportunidades de venta, pues atiende con calidad a sus clientes , quienes son los que la han posicionado en su mercado.
texts.en:
Carminia, 55, lives in the southwest of the city and has a fruit stand and variety store which have given her a good income with which to maintain her household and four children, aged 25 to 28.  She was born in Santa Marta, the oldest city in Colombia and second oldest in South America.  At the age of 11, she moved to Barranquilla and formed a family at age 17, when her first son was born.  To help with family expenses she began selling vegetables from home and gradually her business grew and she added a variety of merchandise.  She buys her goods in cash and sells them on a cash or credit basis.  

Carminia is requesting her first Credikiva loan, which is her first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She plans to use it to buy school supplies and seasonal fruit, such as pears, apples and grapes.  Her location is the greatest asset of her business since it gives her ample sales opportunities.  She offers a quality service and her customers are the ones who have positioned her where she is in the marketplace.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit, such as pears, apples and grapes, and school supplies.

loans.name: Victor Julio

texts.es:
Víctor Julio tiene 52 años de edad y vive con su familia en una comunidad llamada San Carlos, en la segunda provincia de Costa Rica, Alajuela. En una zona donde se ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña. Produce además granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz), frutas, legumbres, tubérculos y hortalizas. Y en esta provincia está ubicado el Aeropuerto Internacional Juan Santamaría, el más importante del país.

Desde hace unos meses que Víctor Julio necesita algún tipo de ayuda para continuar con su negocio y abastecer su ciclo con todo lo que necesita, ya que necesita incrementar sus ingresos económicos para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Para asi de igual manera brindarles a los vecinos de la comunidad un servicio más rápido y eficiente.

Es por eso que Víctor Julio está solicitando un préstamo por el monto de ¢600,000.00 (seiscientos mil colones), esto para comprar repuestos  de bicicletas para su taller de bicicletas conocido como “ciclo” y también para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Víctor Julio es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de El Encanto de Pital y es su primer préstamo, en una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Continuara creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Víctor Julio, 52, lives with his family in a community called San Carlos, which is the second largest province of Costa Rica, Alajuela.  This location is ranked first in national coffee and sugar cane production.  It also produces basic grains (rice, beans, corn), fruit, legumes, tubers and vegetables.  Also located in this province is the Juan Santamaría International Airport, the most important one in the country.

For several months Víctor Julio has been needing help to continue with his business and obtain all the supplies he needs for his bicycle repair shop, in an effort to increase his income and provide for his children.  He also wants to give the neighbors in his community a fast, efficient service.

Therefore, Víctor Julio is requesting a loan in the amount of 600,000 CRC to buy spare parts for his bicycle workshop which is known as "Ciclo", and also to give his family a better quality of life.

Víctor Julio is a member of the communal bank "El Encanto de Pital" and this is his first loan through EDESA, which is one of the 150 member associations in Costa Rica.  He will continue growing both personally and economically, while participating actively in loan organization in his community.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to repair bicycles.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick, 43, is married to Litha, a farmer. They are blessed with three children, aged 25, 20 and 16 years. Patrick has been in the livestock trading business for the past three years, with a monthly income of 20,000 KES which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by a staff member. Patrick will use the loan to buy more sheep and goats to rear for trading.

With the anticipated profit from the business, Patrick will educate his children. His hope and dream is to buy a pick-up truck for transporting the livestock to different markets.

loans.use: to buy more sheep and goats to rear for trading.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen, 45, is married with seven children, four of whom are in school. She has had a business selling foodstuff in Yambio, South Sudan for six months.

Hellen is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and cassava flour. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and cassava flour for resale.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: Kenneth, 27, is married with one child. He runs a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in this business for three years and has employed one person. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 90,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Diana Margarita

texts.es: Diana de 32 años de edad es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de refrescos y mercancía variada en su propia residencia, ubicada en  un barrio del sur de la ciudad. En su negocio vende bebidas frías, electrodomésticos menores, mediante el sistema de encargo. Ella compra de contado y vende a crédito de acuerdo con los pedidos de sus clientes. En la actualidad su creciente clientela hace pedidos y ella debe recuperar primero su cartera, (dinero que está en las manos de los clientes que pagan la mercancía mediante plazos mensuales, quincenales) para poder responderles oportunamente. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará en mayor cantidad refrescos, aprovechando que se acerca la época de carnavales y con ella el incremento de sus ventas, así mismo comprará mercancía fundamentada en pedidos de sus clientes para disfrutar su carnaval, como accesorios femeninos, calzado entre otros. Su meta más adelante es convertir su negocio en una refresquería, donde además venda mercancía variada en un punto muy comercial e independiente de su casa. Mientras esto ocurre, en su negocio maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 23%, unas  cuentas por cobrar que rotan cada 8 días, indicadores financieros  desde los que proyectamos su crecimiento.
texts.en:
32-year-old Diana is a saleswoman.  Her business is selling soft drinks and merchandise from her own home which is located in a neighborhood in the south of the city.  In her business, she sells cold drinks and small electrical appliances which people order from her.  She buys for cash and sells on credit in accordance with her customers' orders.  Right now, her growing customer base is making orders and she must first recover her portfolio (money which is in the hands of customers who pay for their merchandise through monthly or fortnightly payments) so that she is able to respond to them in a timely manner.  This is why she is requesting a Kiva loan (the first loan she has had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo).

Diana will use her loan to buy soft drinks in larger quantities, making the most of the fact that Carnival season is approaching and this is a time when her sales increase.  She will also buy merchandise which her customers have ordered in order to enjoy Carnival such as ladies' accessories, footwear, etc.  Diana's goal for the future is to turn her business into a soft drinks store where she can also sell a variety of merchandise, in a very commercial area which is separate from her home.  While she works towards this, she maintains a return on sales (operating margin) of no less than 23% and an accounts receivable turnover of eight days.  These are the financial indicators from which we project her growth.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, ladies' accessories, footwear, etc. in large quantities

loans.name: Norma Maria

texts.es:
Doña Norma continua comercializando ropa, cosmetico, logrando apoyar a su esposo con los gastos, sus dos hijos estudian y su esposo sigue trabajando como conductor.
Hoy en dia doña Norma esta contenta por que tiene su propio terreno, ya que todos estos años ha vivido junto a su mama, en cuarto aparte, pero ahora esta comenzando con su nueva casa, construida de laminas de zinc y que espera ir construyendo poco  a poco.
Con este nuevo prestamo sera para comprar ropa escolar a mas cantidad en camisa, falda, calcetas, zapatos escolares, a si como cosmeticos el cual los vende por encargos. Obteniendo mejores resultados de venta.
texts.en:
Norma continues to sell clothes and cosmetics, supporting her husband with expenses. Her two children go to school and her husband is still working as a driver.

Today Norma is pleased because she has her own land. All of this time she has lives with her mother in a separate room, but now she is starting her new house. It will be made from zinc sheeting and she hopes to build it little by little. 

This new loan will be to buy school clothing in greater quantities, such as shirts, skirts, socks, and school shoes, as well as cosmetics that she sells by orders. This is in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy school clothing in greater quantities,  as well as school shoes and cosmetics in order to increase her sales.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila, 37, is from Kilgoris town and is married to Meshack, with whom she has five children, aged five to 14 years.

For the past seven years, Leila has operated a cereal selling business, earning a monthly income of 8,100 KES. She is taking her second loan from KADET Ltd to buy more stock, namely 10 sacks of maize and beans. Her profits will be used to farm.

Her dream is to grow her business through stocking more cereals.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of maize and beans.

loans.name: Kide

texts.en:
Kide is a 26-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba Nimule. She is married and has 2 children between the ages of 9 and 7 years old who both go to school. 

Kide runs a retail shop; she has been in the business for 2 years. She has no employees. Kide heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients, outreach and promotion done by the loan officers. She is taking a loan of 700 SDG  to purchase more items such as sugar, sweets, Nomi (a brand of detergent) and beer.  She has no other source of income. 

In 5 years time, Kide hopes that her business will grow incrementally. 

Her major challenges include home expenses and expensive goods that require a great deal of capital.  

Kide says that she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support, and God bless the company to grow.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as sugar, sweets, Nomi (a brand of detergent) and beer

loans.name: Nome

texts.en:
Nome, 29, is married with four children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business selling clothes in Yambio, South Sudan for six years.

Nome is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, 43, is from Kilgoris town, West Kenya and is married to Benta, with whom he has four children aged six to 12 years.

George operates a tailoring business. He has been in this business for 12 years, making a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). He has applied for his fourth loan from KADET Ltd to buy stock of textile materials for dressmaking. He will use his profits to repay the loan and educate his children.

His dream is to open another outlet.

loans.use: to buy stock of textile materials for dressmaking.

loans.name: Trizah

texts.en:
Trizah, 27, is from Homabay and married to James, with whom she has a 9 year old child.

For the past four years, Trizah has operated a business selling second hand clothes, making a monthly income of 6,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). She is taking her first loan from KADET Ltd to buy a bale of second hand clothing for resale. She will use profits to educate her child.

Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bales of second hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 40 years old and married with three children. She does poultry farming to earn a living.  She has been in the business for 3 years. She also does cattle farming to earn extra income. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income.  Alice hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 40,000 KES to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 35 years old, married and a mother of two children. She operates a cafe in Malindi town and has been in the business for the last seven years, earning a monthly profit of 20,000 KES. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the organization's credit officers, and she is applying for her second loan of 40,000 KES. She will use the loan to add food stock, plates and spoons and teacups. 

She will save the anticipated profit and help take care of her children. In the future, Agnes hopes to grow her cafe and be financially stable.

loans.use: to add  food stock, plates and spoons, dishes and teacups

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 40 years old. He is married to Eunice, 39 years old. Together they have three children aged 17,14 and seven years. He owns a butchery and has been in the business for the past seven years. He gets a monthly income of KES 11,000.

This is his first loan term with KADET. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET client. He will use the loan amount to purchase goats and for slaughtering. His dream is to own a plot of land where he can build rental houses.

loans.use: to add to his stock  of meat for sale.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana de 42 años, vive con sus dos pequeños hijos en la ciudad de Barranquilla; ella es la propietaria de una sala de belleza y estética muy bien ubicada. Entre su oferta de productos están los masajes y limpiezas capilares principalmente. Ella inició su negocio trabajando a domicilio después de terminar sus estudios y gradualmente con su disciplina logró comprar sus activos fijos, para ubicarse en un espacio donde poder ofrecerlos a una comunidad, inicialmente conformada por sus antiguas clientes; allí le dio buen resultado porque a su clientela fueron adicionándose amigas, vecinas y referidos, que identifican sus potencialidades y la recomiendan. En la actualidad planea comprar al por mayor los insumos para hacer masajes y limpiezas corporales, pero quiere hacerlo de contado y en mayor cantidad que la acostumbrada, para obtener buenos descuentos. Su sueño es lograr adicionar a su oferta clases de aeróbicos, su mayor desafío es comprar productos en mayor volumen, porque son costosos debido a la calidad de las marcas que aplica a sus clientes. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará cremas para la limpieza  cosmética y para masajes en mayor cantidad, con el fin de seguir aumentando su buena rentabilidad sobre las ventas y también invertirá en hacer adecuaciones locativas que generaran mayor confort entre su exclusiva clientela..
texts.en:
42-year-old Diana lives with her two young children in the city of Barranquilla.  She is the owner of a very well located beauty salon.  The main services she offers are massages and body scrubs.  She started her business working from home after finishing her studies.  Gradually, with discipline, she managed to buy fixed assets and locate her business in a space where she could offer her services to a community which would initially consist of her existing customers.  She had good results there as friends, neighbors and people who she had been recommended to started becoming new customers.  They noted her potential and recommended her.  

Diana currently plans to buy the supplies she needs to carry out massages and body scrubs, wholesale, but she wants to buy for cash and in larger quantities than she is used to so that she can obtain good discounts.  Diana's dream is to add aerobics classes to her existing offerings.  Her greatest challenge is buying products in larger volumes because they are expensive owing to the good quality of the brands that she uses on her customers.  For this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan (her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo).  She will use her loan to buy cleansing creams, cosmetic creams and massage creams in larger quantities so that she can continue increasing her good return on sales.  She will also invest in making some structural improvements to her business which will provide her exclusive customer base with more comfort.

loans.use: to buy cleansing creams, cosmetic creams and massage creams in larger quantities.  She will also make some structural improvements to her business

loans.name: José Tereso

texts.es:
El señor José Tereso se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía mexicanas de acerró desde hace ya mas de tres años. Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar material que es acerró y pintura especial, como tiene varios pedidos pendientes de entregar y no cuenta con el capital necesario para la inversión.
El señor José Tereso es originario de la ciudad de San Luis Potosí y radica en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo desde hace mas de 15 años y cuneta con una hija pequeña la cual solo tiene seis meses de edad. Don José Tereso para contar con mayor ingreso inicia un nuevo negocio de ventas de abarrotes tiene aproximadamente seis meses con este negocio. 
Desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia que tenga un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
José Tereso's business is making Mexican handicrafts from steel.  He has been in this business for more than three years.  He is requesting a loan to buy materials (steel and special paint) as he has several orders to deliver and he doesn't have the capital he needs to invest.

José Tereso is originally from the city of San Luis Potosí and has been based in the city of Nuevo Laredo for more than 15 years.  He has a young daughter who is only six months old.  In order to make more income, José Tereso started a new business selling groceries.  He has been in this business for approximately six months.  He would like to improve his family's quality of life so that they can enjoy a better future.

loans.use: to buy materials for making steel handicrafts

loans.name: Angelica Roberta

texts.es:
La señora Angelica Roberta es casada, tiene 36 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 7 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la artesanía a la confección de cortes de diferente diseños y colores, unció siendo operaria y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia en este trabajo, cuenta con al apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al mismo trabajo.

Solicita un prestamos que lo utilizara para la compra de materiales consistente en hilos de diferentes colores y clases, espera en el futuro contar con trabajadores.
texts.en:
Angelica Roberta is married and is 36 years old. She didn't have the chance to go to school and has 7 children, who are in school. She works making artisanal clothing in different styles and colors. She is the only worker and so far has 10 years experience in this work. She has the support of her husband, who does the same work.

She is asking for a loan which she will use to buy materials such as thread in different types and colors. In the future, she hopes to have employees..

loans.use: to buy thread.

loans.name: Ernesto Jhovany

texts.es:
El Señor Ernesto Jhovany es casado, tiene 38 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 5 hijos los cuales estudian, se dedica a la agricultura y la preproducción espacies, como condimentos de comidas, etc, lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica al mismo oficio.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de semillas y envoltorios para el empaque de las especias, y mejorar su venta y ganancias, en el futuro espera contar con una fabrica.
texts.en:
Ernesto Jhovany is 38 years old and married.  He studied three years of 'educación primaria' (obligatory education for children aged 7-14).  Ernesto has five children who are all in school.  His business is farming and preparing spices which are to be used in cooking, etc.  He has 10 years experience and has the support of his wife who works in the same trade.

Ernesto is requesting a loan which he will use to buy seeds and packaging for his spices.  This will help him to improve his sales and profits.  In the future, he hopes to own a factory.

loans.use: to buy seeds and packaging for spices

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana, 30, is single with no children. She has had a business selling fish in Yambio, South Sudan for three years.

Susana is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Mohssen

texts.en:
Mohssen, 32, is from Iraq and married with three children. He is a carpenter and in 2000 decided to open his own workshop, making bedrooms and furniture. He has sufficient experience in this field, a good reputation and is well known in his area.

Mohssen decided to apply for a loan of $2600 in order to purchase iron supports for machine parts. He is aiming to gain more profit to provide him with the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase iron supports for machine parts.

loans.name: Enemy Shame Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Enemy Shame” group from Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 3,700,000 SLL for the entire group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions.

Abie is the leader of this group. At 32, she is married to a security guard and they have three children. Abie has been a businesswoman for many years, selling onions, rice, palm oil, pepper, salt, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale prices to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy onions, rice, palm oil, pepper, salt, etc. at wholesale prices to add to her business.

loans.name: Subbeh Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kadiatu was born in Lunsar town about twenty-nine years ago. She is married to a craftsman and the couple has five children, four of whom are attending schools. 

Kadiatu has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells items like toothpastes, soaps, Vaseline, medicines, books, pens, drinks, etc. With the help of this loan, Kadiatu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Kadiatu will use her share of the loan (600,000 SLL) to buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy items like toothpastes, soaps, Vaseline, medicines, books, pens, drinks, etc. at wholesale to add to her current ones

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
For the last 10 years, Josephine has been selling fruits and vegetables in Emali town. She is a 54-year-old single mother of one child who is going to school. 

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a KADET staff. She has good credit history with KADET Ltd. She repaid her previous loan well and in good time. She intends to use the loan amount to add stock of tomatoes, onions, potatoes and mangoes.

In future, Josephine hopes to expand her business to open a wholesale grocery shop.

loans.use: to add stock of tomatoes, onions, potatoes and mangoes.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 30-year-old married woman with three children and all of them are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Yambio, South Sudan, for three years.

Esther is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 25 years old and married with two children. She sells secondhand clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for 6 years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 44-year-old lady married to Charles and they have four children aged 14 to 21 years. They come from Kisumu city in the western part of Kenya. 

Ruth operates a beauty salon and has been doing this business for the last 12 years.  She makes a monthly income of 15,000 KES. She is taking her first loan with KADET Ltd., which she will use to purchase two more hair driers. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business. 

Her dream is to establish a big salon and pay her children's school fees comfortably.

loans.use: to buy hair driers

loans.name: Adjaratou Yacine

texts.fr: Madame Adjaratou Yacine exerce le commerce depuis plus de 10 ans .Elle a une expérience dans le crédit car a fait parti d’un groupement ou elle était la trésorière et ou elle a bénéficié de plusieurs  prêts qui lui ont permet d’avoir un bon départ dans son activité. Cette dernière qui consiste  à vendre des sacs, des chaussures, des tissus de l’encens etc.…Adjaratou Yacine est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle  épaule son frère   qui est médecin en lui tenant la comptabilité de sa clinique. Ce qui lui fait une autre source de revenu. Elle aimerait diversifier son commerce et augmenter la quantité de ses marchandises.
texts.en:
Madame Adjaratou Yacine has been in business for 10 years.  She has experience with credit since she was a member of a group of which she was treasurer and she has benefitted from several loans which have allowed her to get a good start in her business.  Her latest business involves sales of handbags, shoes, fabric, incense, etc. Adjaratou Yacine is married and the mother of three children.  She assists her brother who is a doctor by keeping the books for his clinic, which is another source of income for her.  She would like to diversify her business and increase the quantity of her merchandise. 

Madame Adjaratou Yacine exerce le commerce depuis plus de 10 ans .Elle a une expérience dans le crédit car a fait parti d’un groupement ou elle était la trésorière et ou elle a bénéficié de plusieurs  prêts qui lui ont permet d’avoir un bon départ dans son activité. Cette dernière qui consiste  à vendre des sacs, des chaussures, des tissus de l’encens etc.…Adjaratou Yacine est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle  épaule son frère   qui est médecin en lui tenant la comptabilité de sa clinique. Ce qui lui fait une autre source de revenu. Elle aimerait diversifier son commerce et augmenter la quantité de ses marchandises.

loans.use: to buy handbags, shoes, fabric and incense.

loans.name: Victor Antonio

texts.es:
Victor es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y dedicada a su familia. Desde hace aproximadamente 2 años, Victor inició su negocio de tienda general en la cual vende productos de la canasta familiar, con el ánimo de generar los ingresos suficientes para el sostenimiento de su hogar, donde convive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos. Victor tiene este negocio como su fuente de ingresos para poder ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Gracias a sus buenos productos y al buen servicio que ofrece, Victor tiene una gran clientela que le permite tener un muy buen nivel de ventas.

Con el ánimo de generar mayores ingresos y poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos, Victor quiere aumentar el surtido de productos de su tiene, sin embargo, no cuenta con un capital suficiente para poder comprar los productos a sus proveedores, por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de la canasta familiar para surtir su tienda y ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes.

Victor espera con este préstamo poder aumentar sus ventas ya que ofrecerá más productos a sus clientes. Además, sueña con que su negocio crezca y pueda montar un supermercado, del cual sus hijos puedan gozar de una estabilidad económica. Espera poder ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y mayores posibilidades de progreso.
texts.en:
Victor is a very hard-working person who is devoted to his family.  Approximately two years ago Victor started his business, a general store selling staples.  He did this in order to generate enough income to support his household, where he lives with his wife and four children.  This business is Victor’s source of income so that he is able to give his family a better quality of life. Thanks to his good products and the good service that he offers Victor has a large clientele, which allows him to have a very good level of sales.

With the thought of generating more income and being able to offer his customers a greater variety of products, Victor wants to increase the stock of products that he has.  However, he does not have enough capital to be able to buy the products from his providers.  He therefore has the hope that a loan will give him the opportunity to buy food staples in order to stock his store and offer his customers a greater variety.

Victor hopes that with the loan he will be able to increase his sales because he will be offering his customers more products.  Also, he dreams of his business growing and being able to set up a supermarket so that his children can enjoy financial stability.  He hopes to be able to give his family a better quality of life and greater possibilities for progress.

loans.use: to buy food staples in order to stock his store and offer his customers a greater variety.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa se dedica a la venta de dulces, masitas y refrescos en el kiosco de un colegio en el cual trabaja como portera.
El crédito lo necesita para comprar más dulces para surtir su kiosco para aumentar sus ingresos diarios, pues es el producto que más vende.
Rosa es soltera, no tiene hijos y vive como conserje del colegio donde trabaja ubicado en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Rosa sells sweets, pastries, and soft drinks at a kiosk at a school where she works as a janitor.

She needs the loan to buy more sweets to stock her kiosk in order to increase her daily income.  This is the product that sells the most.

Rosa is single and does not have children.  She works as a school janitor in the city of La Paz.

This is the first time she has worked with IMPRO, and it is the first time she has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of sweets to stock the kiosk where she sells at a school in the city of La Paz.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
Daniela es empleada en una tienda de ropa y también se dedica a la venta de pantalones y artículos para mujer por las noches en un puesto en la calle. El crédito lo requiere para comprar más mercadería de diferente tipo y tener mas ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
  Daniela es soltera, no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres en la zona de Alto Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA. Su historial de créditos muestra que Daniela paga dentro de los límites establecidos en su plan de pagos.
texts.en:
Daniela works in a clothing store, and she also sells pants and women’s items in the evenings at a stand on the street.  She needs the loan to buy more merchandise of different types.  She needs to have more income in order to help her family.

Daniela is single and does not have children.  She lives with her parents in the Alto Sopochachi area of the city of La Paz.

This is the second time she has worked with IMPRO, and it is the first time she has worked with Kiva.  Her loan history shows the Daniela makes her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more pants and items for women to sell at a stand she has on one of the streets of La Paz.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Patricia trabaja en su profesión de abogada independiente, es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijos en la casa de sus padres en la zona de Sopocachi ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo necesita para pagar las pensiones del colegio para los estudios de sus hijos, pues la época de clases ya comienza en Febrero.

Es la tercera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Patricia works as an independent lawyer.  She is a single mother, and she lives with her two children in her parents’ house in the Sopocachi area of the city of La Paz.

She needs the loan to pay school tuition for her children as classes start in February.

This is the third time she has worked with IMPRO, and it is the first time she has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay school tuition for her children.

loans.name: Ingrit Frene

texts.es: Ingrit es socia del Banco Comunal los Claveles, tiene 25 años, es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 1 año, esta soltera, no tiene hijos, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y cerveza al por mayor, fue invitada por una socia, agradece porque le va bien en su negocio y en lo personal, también le gusta las capacitaciones, dice que le ayuda a mejorar como persona, gracias a los préstamos no le falta mercadería arroz, leche, aceite y otros, por que puede surtir su tienda, solicita un préstamo para comprar mas cosas, también quiere comprar mas cerveza por que vio que le da mas ganancia, también esta pensando en hacer recargas para celulares.
texts.en: Ingrit is a member of 'Los Claveles' (Carnations) community bank.  She is 25 years old and has been a member of FINCA Peru for one year.  She is single and doesn't have any children.  Her business is selling groceries and beer wholesale.  She was invited to join FINCA by an existing member.  She is grateful because she is doing well in her business and also in her personal life.  She enjoys the training sessions.  She says that they help her to improve as a person.  Thanks to her loans, she does not lack merchandise (rice, milk, oil, etc.) with which to stock her store.  She is requesting this loan to buy more products.  She would also like to buy more beer because she has seen that it makes her more profits.  She is thinking of starting to sell cell phone minutes.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store business

loans.name: Seriousness Group

texts.en:
Aminata is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Aminata is 45 years old, married to a businessman, and has seven children, four of whom attend school.  She was born in Malal Rochen village. 

For 15 years, Aminata has been selling used clothes. Aminata will use her share of the loan (600,000 SSL) to buy a bale of used clothes. With the help of this loan, Aminata and her teammates will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Siviai

texts.es:
La señora siviai cuenta con 25 años de edad y está casada con el señor Cristino quien es albañil, tienen 1 hijo Eliel de 7 años de edad y cursa el segundo año de primaria, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes con el cual lleva 10 años.
Dice que decidió invertir en esta actividad porque quería independizarse un poco mas y ganar su propio dinero, también para apoyar a su hijo con sus estudios y contar con una mejor solvencia económica y calidad de vida, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como son: leche, aceite, arroz, jabón, galletas, refrescos etc. Para tener mejor surtido.
Doña sivia tiene un gran sueño es el de construir un local para poner su tienda de abarrotes, ya que así podrá tener muy bien surtido y contar con una amplia variedad de productos, puesto que así mejorara e incrementara sus ganancias, para asegurar el futuro de su hijo y pueda tener una muy buena carrera profesional.
Le da las gracias a fundación realidad por el gran apoyo que les están aportando, ya que con esta ayuda ha mejorado su negocio y la vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sivia is 25 years old.  She is married to Cristino, who is a builder.  They have one son, Eliel, who is 7 years old and in the second year of elementary school.  Sivia has a grocery store which she has been running for 10 years.  She says that she decided to invest in this business because she wanted to become a little more independent and earn her own money.  She also wanted to support her son in his studies and enjoy better financial solvency and a better quality of life.
