He started off selling food, but switched to selling clothes because there is a higher profit margin. Jack believes that kind and helpful customer service is the best strategy for his business. He also strives to offer a large quantity and variety to his customers.

Jack has received three loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo, and wishes to take a fourth loan to buy merchandise for his business. He especially wants to use this loan to buy pairs of jeans. 

He repaid the past loans fully and on time. He hopes to one day grow his business large enough to become a supplier in Brazzaville. He uses the profits from his business to bring stability to him and his family. He wishes to ease his family's stress and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for clothes and jeans for his business.

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de alimento para el ganado y pago de mano de obra para la recolección de maicillo, este préstamo le ayudara para obtener concentrado para ganado y finalizar con la recolección de la cosecha del maicillo, ella espera realizar una buena inversión, que durante el préstamo pueda pagar sus cuotas adecuadas, para poder continuar a futuro con este beneficio.
Ella considera que su situación es mejor ahora en comparación al tiempo antes de solicitar el préstamo, además con este apoyo considera que será mejor tambien para su familia.
texts.en:
María is requesting a new loan to buy food for her cattle and to pay for labor for harvesting millet. This loan will help with obtaining concentrated feed for the cattle and complete the harvesting of millet. She hopes to achieve a good investment and submit her payments on time so that she can continue experiencing this benefit in the future.

María considers her situation to be improved when compared to the time prior to the request her loans. In addition, this support will also be an improvement for her family.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed and pay for harvesting labor.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуда умная и целеустремленная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать одного ребенка. Муж предприниматель. Более 7 лет она занимается обработкой сухих фруктов. Имеет хорошие условия для сушки абрикоса. Вся семья помогают ей. Затем Мавлуда продает на местном рынке. Она хотела бы получить займ в размере 4000 Сомони для абрикоса. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Mavluda is an intelligent and goal-oriented woman. She is married and the loving mother of one child. Her husband is an entrepreneur. For over 7 years, Mavluda has been processing dried fruits. She has good work conditions for drying apricots. The entire family helps her. Later Mavluda sells her apricots at the local market. She would like to obtain a loan in the amount of 4,000 TJS to buy apricots. She is hoping for your kind help.

loans.use: to buy apricots

loans.name: Home Base Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Home Base” group from Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 600,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Posseh is the leader of this group. The sixty-year-old is married to a trader and the couple have three children. Posseh has been a businesswoman since her childhood days. Currently, she sells rice and palm-oil.  With her share of this loan, she will buy rice and palm-oil in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy rice and palm-oil in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Groundnut Granner Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Groundnut Granner” group from Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are small businessmen who are requesting loans for 500,000 SSL for each group member from SMT. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Abdul. Abdul is 45 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom attend secondary school. He was born in Lunsar. His wife is a businesswoman. Abdul sells and grinds groundnuts. He also sells gari and baskets. He has requested this loan in order to buy groundnuts in large quantities to grind and sell.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts.

loans.name: Erica

texts.es: Érica de 38 años de edad es una mujer casada que tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 5 a 16 años de edad. Ella tiene un negocio de alimentos donde prepara y vende chichas, gaseosas, jugos, papas rellenas de carne queso, mixtas, deditos de queso y picadas en general, el cual inició cuando viendo a su madre, percibió que ganaba buen dinero con esta actividad.  inicialmente empezó a vender sopa, pasteles, pero gradualmente su disciplina de trabajo y deseos de superación, le fue dando nuevas ideas; hoy no solo vende comidas en pequeñas cantidades, sino que también tiene un punto de venta con vitrinas calentadoras y un enfriador para ofrecer bien helados sus refrescos, venta potencializada por en el incesante clima cálido del Caribe Colombiano. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará materias primas, como mantequilla, harinas, tubérculos, queso , gaseosas  y otros refrescos en mayor cantidad, para ganar descuentos y aumentar su producción en una buena época, como la previa a los carnavales de la Región,  donde la fiesta y el folclor incrementan sus ganancias, por que las agrupaciones se concentran muy cerca a su negocio y le compran para alimentarse y tomar un nuevo impulso que les permita seguir bailando y disfrutando sanamente del folclor caribeño..
texts.en: 38-year-old Érica is a married woman who has three children aged between 5 and 16.  She has a food business where she prepares and sells 'chicha' (a traditional corn-based drink), soda, juice, potatoes stuffed with meat and cheese, cheese fingers, and snacks in general.  She started her business when she realized that her mother earned good money in the same business. At first she started out selling soup and pies but gradually her work ethic and her desire to do well gave her new ideas.  Now she not only sells meals in small quantities but she also has a sales location with heated display cases and a chiller cabinet where she offers nice cold drinks. She has a lot of sales owing to the permanent warm climate of the Colombian Carribean coast.  Erica is currently applying for her first Kiva loan, which will also be her first loan from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy raw materials such as butter, flour, tubers, cheese, soda and soft drinks in larger quantities.  This will earn her discounts and she will be able to increase her production at a good time of year, before the carnival celebrations in her region, when fiesta and folklore increase her profits because people come together very near her business and they come to buy food from her.  This gives them a renewed boost and allows them to continue dancing and enjoying Carribean folklore.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as butter, flour, tubers, cheese, soda and soft drinks in larger quantities so that she can earn discounts

loans.name: Apénifia

texts.fr:
Apénifia est un homme âgé de 36 ans. Il est marié å un/e revendeuse. Il a 03enfants. Le premier a 04ans et les derniers(les jumeaux) 01 an.  
Apénifia travaille comme infirmier  depuis 2002. En plus de son activité, il vend des produits pharmaceutiques à ses patients. Ce prêt qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter des produits génériques pour les soins aux patients.
Apénifia a requis son second  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits pharmaceutiques. Il veut épargner des profits supplémentaires. 
Dans les prochaines années, Apénifia voudrait agrandir son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit d’assurer une meilleure condition à sa famille.
texts.en:
Apénifia is a 36 year old man. He is married to a reseller. He has three children. The first is 4 years old and the youngest (the twins) are 1 year old.

Apénifia has been working as a nurse since 2002. In addition to this profession, he sells pharmaceutical products to his patients. This loan that he is requesting will allow him to buy generic products for the care of patients.

Apénifia has requested his second loan from WAGES in order to buy pharmaceutical products. He wants to save the additional profits.

In the coming years, Apénifia would like to expand his business. He says that with the profits, he plans to ensure a better living condition for his family.

loans.use: to buy generic pharmaceutical products.

loans.name: Dioselina

texts.es: Dioselina es la propietaria de un negocio a través del cual vende ropa interior y cosméticos; con esta actividad ha logrado apoyar la gestión de su hogar, conformado por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 7 y 12 años respectivamente.  Desde hace 5 años, cuando inició esta actividad, lo hizo puerta a puerta, pero de manera gradual, con su disciplina y esfuerzo de trabajo, logró aumentar su clientela y con ello sus utilidades y aprovechando las oportunidades del mercado,  decidió instalarse en un local comercial, aprovechando sus recursos propios y prestamos de familiares, que le proporcionaron su primer capital de trabajo para independizarse en un punto fijo. Hoy sueña con ampliar su negocio y trabaja todos los días, con la expectativa de tener algún día su propia casa para generar bienestar a sus hijos. En la actualidad quiere diversificar su oferta, pues se acerca la temporada escolar y es muy buena época para proveer a colegios y centros educativos de sus uniformes, pero su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente, para responder a esta demanda, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual realizará esta inversión, que planea será exitosa, pues ya hizo su preventa y está  fundamentada  sobre pedidos de clientes recomendados.
texts.en:
Dioselina owns a business that sells undergarments and cosmetics.  Through this business she has been able to support her household which is made up of her husband and their two children ages 7 and 12.  She started this business 5 years ago selling door to door. Gradually, with hard work and discipline, she was able to increase her clientele and her profits, and also, take advantage of market opportunities.  She decided to set up in a commercial space using her own resources and family loans which provided her first working capital towards being independent with a fixed location. Today, she dreams of expanding her business.  She works everyday with the hope of some day having her own house for the benefit of her children.  
 
Currently, she wants to diversify what she offers as the school season is getting close and it is a good time to provide schools and education centers with uniforms, but her working capital is insufficient to meet the demand.  For this reason she is requesting her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to make the investment.  She knows she will be successful as she has already made the pre-sales based on orders from recommended customers.

loans.use: provide uniforms to schools and education centers.

loans.name: Belen

texts.es: Belen, de 54 años, es una mujer muy amable, siempre le hizo frente a las adversidades y a lado de su esposo Walter. Trabaja mucho para así poder sacar adelante a sus cuatro hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes. Ella vive en su casa propia en donde a diario trabaja para tener una vejez tranquila. Cada dos días, Belen se dirige al mercado mayorista de la ciudad, es ahí en donde compra todos los productos que necesita para continuar su venta, pues se dedica a vender algunos productos derivados de harina, además de panes embolsados y algunas golosinas. Por otro lado , se va al puerto de la ciudad para comprar bebidas y enviar a una localidad cerca de la ciudad. Todo este trabajo lo hace con la ayuda de su esposo con quien se siente muy bien trabajando juntos. Durante los 11 años, que se dedica a éste trabajo, siente que aprendió y avanzo mucho ya que tiene la satisfacción de tener sus propios ingresos y además dispone de su tiempo como ella mejor lo crea conveniente. Espera seguir trabajando y poder aumentar su capital para enviar mayor cantidad para su venta. Este será el crédito número 3 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, cabe resaltar que se le ve muy contenta en su banco comunal ya que todos son personas muy responsables, confiable y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará mercadería en pan, kekes, tostadas y enviar a otra localidad, además algunas bebidas para su venta diaria.
texts.en: Belen, who is 54 years old, is a very kind woman. She always faces up to adversities and is at the side of her husband, Walter. She worked hard to be able to raise her four children, who are already adults and are independent. She lives in her own house where she works every day to have a tranquil old age. Every two days, Belen heads for the city wholesale market. Here she buys all the products that she needs to continue her sales, since her business is selling baked products, in addition to bagged breads and some candies. On the other hand, she goes to the city port to buy beverages and send them to a location near the city. All this work she does with the help of her husband, with whom she feels very good working together. During the 11 years in which she has done this work, she feels that she learned and advanced a lot, since she has the satisfaction of having her own income, and furthermore, she arranges her time as it is most convenient for her. She hopes to continue working and be able to increase capital to send out a larger quantity to sell. This will be her third loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support, since this way she will feel secure of advancing in her work. On the other hand, she promises once more to make her loan payments, as she did with previous loans. It should be emphasized that she is very happy in her communal bank since all the people are very responsible, reliable, and united. With the 2000 PEN that she has applied for, she will buy merchandise such as bread, cakes, and tostadas and send them to another location, in addition to some beverages for daily sale.

loans.use: to buy sliced bread, tostadas, cakes, and beverages.

loans.name: Bayarjavkhlan

texts.en:
Bayarjavkhlan, 32, is married and lives with her spouse and family in a small house located on her father-in law’s land in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia.

Bayarjavkhlan and her husband plant, grow and sell trees. Every year they plant from 800,000 to 1,200,000 pines, firs, maples, sea buckthorns, currants and cedars in association with cooperatives on their land. In addition, they replant 20 to 35 hectares of trees in forests and rehabilitate 20 to 30 hectares of land every year.

Bayarjavkhlan is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a new type of tree seed.

loans.use: To purchase a new type of tree seed.

loans.name: El Hadji

texts.fr:
Monsieur  El Hadji  est  tailleur depuis 2005 .Il loue un magasin près  du guichet. Il est marié et père de 2 enfants. Son activité consiste à coudre pour hommes et dames. Il  possède 3 machines  mais cela ne suffit pas car il y a toujours la nouvelle mode qui nécessite d’avoir des machines  qui peuvent faire le travail.
D’ ailleurs le prêt va lui servir à acquérir une nouvelle machine pour pouvoir faire fasse à la demande.
Il a comme charge la location de l’atelier et les frais de scolarité de son enfant de 5 ans. Il souhaite dans l’avenir élargir son atelier  à d’autres activités.
texts.en:
Mister El Hadji has been a tailor since 2005. He rents a store near the local branch. He is married and father to two children. His business consists in sewing for men and women. He owns three machines but this is not enough as there is always new fashion that necessitates having machines that can do the job.

In fact the loan will allow him to obtain a new machine to be able to meet demand.

His responsibilities are the rent of his workshop and the school fees of his 5 year old child. In the future he hopes to expand his workshop to other businesses.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to increase his business.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny de 33 años de edad, es viuda. Pero vive en su casa propia junto a sus 03 hijos quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. En su querido pueblo de Samaniato, ubicado en cusco, Marleny ha pasado la mayor parte de su vida hasta ahora, ahí desde muy niña aprendió la actividad familiar y es por ello que ahora es toda una conocedora de la actividad agrícola. Pasado los años se fue a vivir a otro lugar y ante la perdida de su amado esposo le fue muy difícil con llevar el asunto y solo tuvo que mirar hacia delante y trabajar por sus hijos. Hoy en su parcela cultiva cacao y café, plantas que le viene brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse y cubrir los gastos de educación de sus queridos hijos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero. Lleva 05 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los carros de carga son muy escasos por esta parte de la zona donde vive. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP, y se siente muy contenta de saber que obtendrá un apoyo mas por parte de los financistas, ya que así se sentirá segura de comprar lo solicitado y esta dispuesta a devolver puntualmente sus aportes programados. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará abono y fertilizantes para mejorar la caldiad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Marleny, 33, is a widow. She lives in her own house along with her three children, who are the reason for all her efforts.  Marleny has spent the majority of her life in her beloved town of Samaniato, located in Cusco province.  When she was very young she learned the family work, which is why she is now such an expert on agricultural work.

It was very difficult for her to bear the loss of her beloved husband, and she only had to look ahead and work for her beloved daughter.  On her plot of land she cultivates cacao and coffee plants, which continue giving her the necessary income to support herself and cover the education expenses of her beloved children.

What she likes most about her job is planting her lands, and she does it with a lot of care.  She has been doing this work for five years and she considers the hardest part to be transporting her products, because cargo trucks are very scarce in this part of the jungle region.

This is her first loan with MFP and she feels very happy to know that she will receive more help from the lenders, because in this way she will feel secure about buying what she requested.  She is willing to return the scheduled payments punctually.

With the 1,500 PEN she will buy manure and fertilizer to improve her crops.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Denisse

texts.es: Denisse, de 28 años es una mujer admirable. Vive en compañía de sus padres y hermanos en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de Jauja. Desde joven comenzó a afrontar el negocio de su familia, reparte su tiempo en la venta de queso y sus estudios de Administración de empresas en una universidad reconocida de la ciudad.  En la altura del pueblo de Yauyos, tiene una granja, donde cuida de sus 100 vacas, de las cuales sus padres elaboran queso que ella trae para comercializarlos de acuerdo al peso de los moldes. Cuenta que tiene pedidos de las diferentes ciudades cercanas, que son conocedores de su buena producción. Para cuidar de la calidad ella viaja 2 veces al mes, pues también crían ovejas de las cuales comercializa su carne, “hay meses, donde los pedidos sobrepasan mi producción, para abastecer tengo que comprar a otros ganaderos”, cuenta. Ahora tiene muchos pedidos y espera poder abastecer a sus clientes, pues su objetivo es industrializar su queso. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “San Lorenzo” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Denisse de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios moldes de queso para su negocio.
texts.en:
Denisse is 28 years old and is an admirable woman. She lives with her parents and siblings in their own house in the city of Jauja. When she was young she became part of the family business. She splits her time selling cheese and studying Company Administration in a university that is well known in the city. In the height of the town of Yauyos, she has a farm where she takes care of 100 cows, from which her parents produce cheese that she sells according to the weight of the individual moulds. She says that she has orders from different surrounding cities and that they are known for their good produce. In order to look after quality she travels twice a month as they also rear sheep which they sell for meat. "There are months when the orders exceed production and in order to meet demand I have to buy from other farmers", she says. Now she has many orders and she hopes to supply her customers as her goal is to industrialize her cheese. 

She belongs to the support group "San Lorenzo" and this is her first loan with MFP and she therefore hopes the small loan will allow her to fulfill her goals. On the other hand she promises to make her repayments. Furthermore she is pleased to be part of the association as all the members are responsible and supportive. On receiving her loan, Denisse will invest the requested money in the purchase of several cheese moulds for her business.

loans.use: to buy several cheese moulds.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: En el anexo de Pancan vive Nancy, una mujer de 35 años que conformó su familia con Walter, su esposo desde hace 11 años. Ambos tienen una hija Andrea a la que cuidan en su casa propia. Su casa se ubica entre bosques y pastizales, además de sus terrenos agrícolas donde siembra papa, cebada y maíz en gran cantidad. Agradece a su familia por lo que ahora posee, pues le heredaron los terrenos agrícolas, en los que junto a su esposo cuidan y cosechan los alimentos que venden en el mercado mayorista de su localidad. Pero como la temporada de siembra no es todo el año, cría animales como vacas y cuyes, tiene 8 vacas lecheras, de las cuales vende todos los días leche a los comerciantes lácteos, que la visitan diariamente. Ahí obtiene un dinero extra y también en la venta de los cuyes, cuando están maduros. Por otro lado su esposo se dedica al oficio de albañil, construyendo casa por contratos de acuerdo a ello su ganancia. Ahora desean mejorar su casa con buena infraestructura y así tener un mejor nivel de vida. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “caminando hacia el futuro” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación  porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Nancy de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de cebada.
texts.en: In the annex of Pancan lives Nancy, a woman of 35 years that formed her family with Walter, her husband 11 years ago.  Both have a daughter,  Andrea, which they care for in their own house.  Their house is located between forests and pasturelands, next to their agricultural lands where she sows potatoes, barley and corn in great quantities.  She thanks her family for they now possesses, as they interited the agricultural lands.  Along with her husband she cares for the lands and harvests the food that they sell in the wholesale market of their locality.  Since the sowing season does not last all year, she also raises young animals like cows and guinea pigs.  She has 8 dairy cows, from which she sells milk every day to the milk merchants that visit her daily.  In this way she obtains extra money and also in the sale of guinea pigs, when they are mature.  On the other hand her husband is dedicated to working as a bricklayer, building houses by contract from which he profits.  Now they desire to improve their house with better infrastructure and thus to have a better standard of living.  She belongs to the supportive group called "walking toward the future" and this is her fifth loan with MFP, where she hopes for its contribution  to continue with her objectives.  She also promises to once more comply with the payment schedule.  It pleases her to be part of her association, because all their members are supportive and responsible people.  With this support, Nancy will invest the requested money in the purchase of various bags of natural fertilizers to spread them on her barley crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Ancille

texts.fr:
Ancille  est née au Rwanda. Elle a 56 ans et elle est veuve avec 5 enfants de 17 à 35 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. Elle a 2 personnes dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 2 ans de primaire.
Ancille est cultivatrice de café. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’acheter d’autres champs pour augmenter la plantation du café. Dans les prochaines années, Ancille voudrait être la grande cultivatrice de café. Avec les profits, elle prévoit  d’améliorer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ancille was born in Rwanda. She is 56 years old and she is a widow with 5 children from 17 to 35 years old, of whom 3 were schooled. She has two dependents other than her children. Her level of education is two years of primary school.

Ancille is a coffee farmer. This is her first loan with ACB. She is going to use her loan in order to buy fertilizers.

Her strategy for the growth of her business is to buy other fields to increase the planting of coffee. In the coming years, Ancille would like to be the great coffee farmer. With the profits, she plans to improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Jhoysi

texts.es: Jhoysi, de 29 años de edad, es una mujer empeñosa y emprendedora con muchas de progresar. Está separada del padre de sus hijos, pero vive con ellos y con sus padres en su casa. La actividad que realiza Jhoysi es la agricultura para esto cuenta con un terreno de 5 hectáreas de extensión, la cual es una herencia por parte de sus padres. Cuenta con el apoyo de los peones que la ayudan en la temporada de cosecha cada quince dias. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico constante, para pagar sus gastos, además de considerarlo bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene. Tiene planes de ampliar su sembrío de palmas aceitera por la demanda que tiene en el mercado. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, por lo que espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues los considera un grupo unido y solidario. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y abono para el mantenimiento de sus plantas.
texts.en: Jhoysi is a hard-working, 29-year-old entrepreneur eager to get ahead. She’s separated from the father of her children and lives with her children and her parents in her house. Jhoysi works in agriculture and has 5 hectares of land that she inherited from her parents. She counts on help from the unskilled laborers who work with her during the sowing of the crop every 15 days. She likes her business as it generates constant income to pay for her expenditures and it’s profitable enough for the demand she has. She has plans to expand her palm oil crop because of the demand there is in the market. This will be the 2nd loan with MFP, with which she hopes she can accomplish her objectives. Also, she is comfortable with her Communal Bank as she considers her group very united and supportive. She will invest the loan of 800 soles in the purchase of fertilizer and manure.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and manure.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Licario

texts.es: En el caserío de Huari, vive Licario; un hombre alegre de 40 años que conformó su familia con Justina, su esposa desde hace 20 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos a los cuales cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Huari.  Junto a su esposa se dividen las actividades económicas. Mientras él trabaja en la gobernación de su comunidad, donde recibe un sueldo mensual por parte del estado. Ella cuida de sus 7 vacas, 30 ovejas y 40 llamas, las cuales cría con mucha dedicación, pues es el único patrimonio que poseen, además lo único que ellos saben hacer y es lo que más les gusta. Como Licario es muy conocido, los compradores siempre llegan para comprar sus animales. Su secreto es tener animales reproductores de raza que mejoren las crías. “a ellos no los vende”, afirma.  Asimismo su esposa realiza quesos pequeño o bolillos, un promedio de 9 por día que comercializa a un comerciante que la visita siempre. Por ahora desean mejorar la raza y aumentar la cantidad de ganado. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “los huariñoz” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación  porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Licario de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más ovejas para criarlos y engordarlos.
texts.en:
Licario, a happy 40 year old man, and Justina, his wife of 20 years, live in the small village of Huari. They have 4 children whom they are raising in their own house, situated in the city of Huari. Licario and his wife divide economic tasks. While he works in local government, where he receives a monthly salary from the state, she cares for their 7 cows, 30 sheep and 40 llamas with great dedication, since these are the only assets they own. As well it is the only thing they know how to do and it is what they most enjoy doing.

Licario is very well known. Buyers are always coming to buy his animals. His secret is to have pure-bred breeding animals that improve the offspring: “Those I do not sell” he declares. In addition, his wife makes cheese rolls, an average of 9 per day, which she markets to a merchant who regularly visits her.

Nowadays they want to improve the breed and increase the number of their cattle. He belongs to “Los Huriñoz” Communal Bank and this is his third loan with MFP. He awaits your collaboration so he can achieve his goals. He promises once again to comply with the payment schedule. He is also happy to be part of his bank because all the members are responsible and supportive people. Upon receiving your support, Licario will invest the money in the purchase of more sheep to raise and fatten.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.fr:
Emmanuel est né au Rwanda. Il a 33 ans et il est marié avec 2 enfants de 3 mois à 4 ans, dont 1 enfant sont scolarise. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de secondaire.

Emmanuel est commerçant. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter une photocopieuse à utilise pour son projet de secrétariat.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est cherche des marché de plus pour avoir beaucoup la clientèle. Dans les prochaines années, Emmanuel voudrait  fonder un grand projet des services informatique. Avec les profits, il prévoit  de scolariser ses enfants et améliore le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Emmanuel was born in Rwanda. He is 33 years old and he is married with 2 children from 3 months to 4 years old, of whom 1 child is in school. His level of education is 3 years of secondary school.

Emmanuel is a businessman. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan in order to buy a photocopier to use for his secretarial project.

His strategy for the growth of his business is to look for more markets to have many clients. In the coming years, Emmanuel would like to fund a large information services project. With the profits, he plans to school his children and improve his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier to use for his secretarial project.

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en:
Sameera is a 43-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and she is a mother of six children.

Sameera is selling mobile phone prepaid cards and mobile phone accessories.

Sameera is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase mobile phone accessories with an aspiration of improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phone accessories for business purposes.

loans.name: Fatimah

texts.en:
Due to cultural issues Fatimah was not willing to have her picture uploaded on the internet so the man in the photo is her brother.

Fatimah is a 34-year-old single lady from Madaba, Jordan. She has a home-based grocery store and she is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to purchase more goods for the store.

Fatimah is looking to expand her business and improve her family's  living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her grocery store.

loans.name: Therese

texts.en:
Therese, a 50-year-old single mother with four children, three of whom attend school, has operated a business selling men's and women's clothing in Brazzaville for 12 years. Therese, who is patient with her customers and always willing to assist them, has found that good customer service is the key to her business success. Her major difficulty is the fluctuating buying power of her customers, so some months she sells many things and other months she sells very little.

Therese, who has received and repaid three previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner, is requesting a new one to buy more men's and women's clothing from a supplier. As her business continues to grow, she hopes to one day build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase men's and women's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Juvet

texts.en: Juvet is a single father with one child who attends school. He sells women's clothes in a local market in Brazzaville. He has successfully run this business for seven years. He uses loans to buy women's clothing from a supplier in Brazzaville. Juvet's business strategy is to provide a large variety of clothing to attract customers. He finds his customers are most happy when they can find unique, stylish clothing. He has received three loan from HOPE Congo and has fully repaid them in a timely manner. He is looking forward to taking another loan to continue to increase the variety of clothing styles he offers. He uses the success of his business to bring stability and improved living conditions to his family.

loans.use: to pay for men and women's clothes to s.

loans.name: Jonas

texts.fr:
Jonas est né au Rwanda. Il a 45 ans et il est marié avec 7 enfants de 1 à 16 ans, dont 4 enfants sont scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 1 an de secondaire.

Jonas est salarie. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter ciment, sable, planches et payer la main d’œuvre pour le finissage de sa maison.

Dans les prochaines années, Jonas voudrait un entrepreneur. Avec les profits, il prévoit  de scolariser ses enfants et améliore le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jonas was born in Rwanda. He is 45 years old and is married with 7 children from 1 to 16 years old, of whom 4 are in school. His level of education is 1 year of secondary school.

Jonas is an employee. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan in order to buy cement, sand, boards and pay for the labor for the finishing of his house.

In the coming years, Jonas would like to become an entrepreneur. With the profits, he plans to school his children and improve his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, boards and pay for the labor for the finishing of his house.

loans.name: Bushotsi

texts.fr:
Bushotsi est née au Rwanda. Il a 45 ans et il est marié, avec 7 enfants de 2 à 19 ans  dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de secondaire.

Bushotsi est commerçante. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin de payer le frais scolaire de ses enfants.

Dans les prochaines années, Bushotsi voudrait avoir son propre business. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Bushotsi was born in Rwanda. He is 45 years old and is married, with 7 children from 2 to 19 years old of whom 4 are in school. His level of education is 6 years of secondary school.

Bushotsi is a shopkeeper. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan in order to pay for his children's school fees.

In the coming years, Bushotsi would like to have his own business. With the profits, he plans to school his children.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rabeea

texts.en:
Rabeea, 29 years old and a married woman, has three daughters and one son.

Rabeea has started a small business selling home products, basically kitchen tools, to help in improving the family living conditions.

Now Rabeea has applied for a loan to buy more home products and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more home products for resale.

loans.name: Ruqaya

texts.en:
Ruqaya, 30 years old and a single lady, has two brothers and is the oldest among five sisters.

Ruqaya has two businesses, first is a food products market as shown in the photo; the other is clothes and accessories sales, which she does at home.

Ruqaya wants to improve the food market, so she has applied for a loan to add more products so she can open a new food market and register it officially.

loans.use: to add more products.

loans.name: Tashisia

texts.en:
Since she was in high school, Tashisia has dreamed of becoming a business woman. After much deliberation, in January 2009, she opened her own business, Personal House Cleaner, which provided high quality residential cleaning. As her business grew, she was able to employ two employees and take her business online using the domain name, www.personalhousecleaner.com. 

Tashisia now has a steady client base, which urges her to move her business into the corporate cleaning world, as well as the residential. However, the regulations businesses hold are very strict. Tashisia would like to expand her business into this new realm, but must equip herself first. In the near future, she hopes to move into the corporate cleaning world, have five employees, and continue the growth of her business. This loan would be used to support this move into a new market by helping her purchase larger cleaning equipment and expand her marketing to this new endeavor.

loans.use: To expand her business into new markets.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John established "Timing Is Everything" (TIE) Professional Food Services, Inc, 12 years ago as a full-service catering company. TIE offers party idea services, in which individual consultation can be arranged, or full-service party planning and catering can be provided. In addition, entertainment and specially requested themes can be arranged through the company. Previously, John worked full-time at Gagosian Art Gallery in Manhattan, but he has recently reduced this to part-time due to the success of TIE.

 John aspires to grow his business to the point where no customer has to be turned down due to lack of initial funds. Initial capital is needed due to the payment scheme that is set up. Half the party is paid upfront and half is paid after the event. A loan is being pursued to prevent over-booking by allowing the company the working capital to purchase the materials for a party, no matter the size.

loans.use: to have working capital for preparation of any party, no matter what the size.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La señora Marisol cuenta con 37 años de edad y está casada su esposo se llama José Luis con quien tienen 2 hijos Esther y Martin quienes cursan segundo y primer año de primaria, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hacen 4 años.
Doña Marisol dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, ya que quería buscar la manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y con la educación de sus hijos, también para tener una mejor solvencia económica y calidad de vida, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como son: azúcar, refrescos, aceite, galletas, pan, frijol, leche, huevos, jabón y papel higiénico, para tenerlo mejor surtido 
La meta que ella tiene para su negocio es la de hacerlo crecer muchísimo, ya que quiere ampliar su local ya que así tendrá un amplio surtido, para así tener una mejor producción y ventas para contar con mejores ingresos.
Esta muy agradecida con los donadores de kiva y FRAC, por todo el apoyo y confianza que le están brindando, ya que gracias a esta ayuda ahora puede continuar invirtiendo en su negocio y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Marisol is 37 years old and is married.  Her husband's name is José Luis.  Together they have 2 children, Esther and Martin, who are in their first and second years of elementary school.   Señora Marisol has had a small grocery store for 4 years.
Doña Marisol says that she decided to start this business because she wanted to find a way to help her husband with the household expenses and with their children's education.  She also wanted to have more financial solvency and a better quality of life.  The loan that she received will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise such as: sugar, sodas, cooking oil, cookies, bread, beans, milk, eggs, soap and toilet paper, to better stock her store.
Doña Marisol's business goal is to grow it a lot.  She wants to expand her store to have a wider variety of stock, which would generate better production and sales so she could count on a better income.
Doña Marisol is very grateful for the KIVA and FRAC donors, for all the support and confidence they have placed in her.  Thanks to their help, she can now continue investing in her business and supporting her family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of more merchandise such as: sugar, sodas, cooking oil, cookies, bread, beans, milk, eggs, soap and toilet paper.

loans.name: Misael

texts.es:
Misael, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio comprando ganado y unos cerdos, ya que quiere aumentar el número de reces en sus tierras y la granja de cerdos, él considera que el préstamo anterior fue un gran aporte para fortalecer su actividad ganadera.
La condición en la que se encuentra Misael es mejor tanto para él como para su familia, espera que de la misma manera sea esta nueva deuda, que le permita ir mejorando poco a poco.
texts.en:
Misael is requesting a new loan to invest in his business.  He will purchase cattle and some pigs.  He wants to increase the number of animals on his land and his pig farm.  Misael feels that the previous loan was a great support in strengthening his livestock business.
Misael's current situation in better for himself and well as for his family.  He hopes that this new loan will do the same, that it will enable him to improve little by little.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and some pigs.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Originally from Guatemala, Luis jumped on the opportunity to come to the United States six years ago for financial means. He has three boys still in Guatemala that rely on him heavily for financial support which he sends back to them. Luis lives in Miami now and owns a beach rental service that rents out umbrellas and beach chair to residents and tourists. He goes through seasonal rushes, but has made good relationships with local residents to keep him busy year round in this competitive market. 

Luis has grown his business to now employ three other employees. He hopes that in the future he can expand his business further to employ more people and stand out as the best business in his market. Luis will use this loan to replace old chairs and umbrellas and to purchase a larger quantity to fully take advantage of the up-and-coming spring rental season.

loans.use: to purchase and repair inventory.

loans.name: Corey

texts.en:
Corey has owned "Save to Pave," a construction contractor in Appomattox, VA, since 2005 and has been operating it since 2008. Save to Pave paves and seals residential and public pathways, driveways, golf courses, as well as government projects on city streets. Much of this business is done seasonally between the months of April and October, so Corey works rigorously throughout the off-season to sign contracts that will secure business throughout the next year. 

Due to his business set-up, clients do not pay for the job until it is complete; this leaves much upfront capital for Corey to endure. He would like this loan to repair damaged equipment and purchase additional equipment and asphalt tools. He also hopes to build a long-lasting credit relationship.

loans.use: to purchase and repair equipment.

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.en: Alexandre opened his own painting company in Weymouth, MA, over a year ago with many clients residing in the South Shore. He has kept his business home-based and informal but has continued to grow due to the quality of work that he has provided to his clientele. In addition to running his own business, Alexandre also is still working with another painting company as a sub-contractor. The purpose of this loan is to purchase more equipment for both of his endeavors. He also would like to use this loan to continue building credit.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and build a credit line.

loans.name: Munkhtsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs.Munkhtsetseg, 54, runs a grocery store in her backyard.  She lives with her husband and her two daughters in the old house, which is in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  She has been running her store successfully during last few years.  Now she needs to increase her store working capital to expand her business.  

The loan she is borrowing will be used to purchase some groceries to expand her volume of sales.  She says she has a plan to open her second grocery store in the next year.

loans.use: to purchase some groceries to expand her volume of sales.

loans.name: Tsevelmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Tsevelmaa, 43, rents a retail stall in the bazaar of Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia.  Actually, she sells underwear.  She has been running her business since last year and before she used to work as a seller in the market.  Currently her business is being run successfully and she already has had many customers.  But the working capital size is not big enough for her planning sales volume.  Therefore she wants to increase the working capital of her business.  The loan she is requesting will be dedicated to purchase some clothes for her retail business.

loans.use: to purchase some clothes for her retail business.

loans.name: Diarra

texts.fr:
Diarra est une femme mariée âgée de 75 ans et mère de 9 enfants dont 4 petit fils à sa charge.
Elle est membre du banc villageois de Kiwi depuis le premier son premier cycle.
Elle appartient au groupe de solidarité AND JEF.
Diarra est vendeuse de cous cous qu'elle fabrique elle même, elle pratique cette activité depuis longtemps  c'est la raison pour la qu'elle elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.
Avec son nouveau crédit de 250000 elle va acheter du mil qu elle fabriquer du cous cous qu'elle va revendre dans son village au détails.
Diarra nous dit que les bénéfices générés par son activité lui permettent de payer de la nourriture à la maison.
texts.en:
Diarra is a 75 year old married woman and mother to 9 children. She has 4 grandchildren under her care.

She is a member of the "banc villageois" of Kiwi since her first loan cycle.

She belongs to the solidarity group And Jef.

Diarra is a couscous seller which she makes herself. She has been practicing this business for a long time. This is why she has good experience in this domain.

With her new 250,000 loan she is going to buy mil [African cereal] which she will make into couscous which she will resell retail in her village.

Diarra tells us that the profits generated by her business will allow her to pay for food at home.

loans.use: to buy mil [African cereal] and mil flour to make couscous.

loans.name: Ngoné Nar

texts.fr:
Madame Ngoné est une femme mariée âgée de 61 ans et mère de 2 enfants :
Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis le cycle un dudit Banc Villageois.
Elle fait parti du groupe de solidarité AND JEF.
Ngoné fait du petit commerce dans la vente de mil,, de farine de mil et du cous cous qu'elle fait elle pré fabrique.
Son expérience dans son domaine d'activité est grande pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis longtemps.
Avec son nouveau crédit de 500000 elle va se procurer des sacs de mil pour l’exercice de son activité génératrice de revenus.
Madame Ngoné nous informe qu'avec ses bénéfices elle compte renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du BV et renforcer également son cheptel de moutons et de chèvres;
texts.en:
Mrs. Ngoné is a 61-year-old married woman with two children. She is a member of the AND JEF solidarity group and has been with the local Banc Villageois since its first cycle. 

Ngoné sells millet, millet flour and couscous, which she makes herself. She has many years of experience in this activity. 

She plans to use this new loan of 500,000 CFAF to buy sacks of millet. She will use the profits to bolster her savings with the Banc Villageois and to increase her flock of sheep and goats.

loans.use: to buy millet, millet flour, and couscous for resale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a native-born New Yorker and opened his own fitness facility, ESPI Fitness Inc., over two years ago, after acquiring much experience in the field of personal training. Emmanuel aspires to use his experience in the fitness field to empower the youth of his community both physically and mentally, by providing them with essential skills in leadership, teamwork and confidence. 

After franchising with Parisi Speed, a fitness center that provides training for young athletes to help them achieve their full potential, Emmanuel had the clientele to expand his operation into a larger facility. In May of last year he made the move to a larger facility. With the help of his wife, Nicole, who also works a full-time job with Space Coast Credit Union, they manage the facilities. Emmanuel feels that this space provides a better layout and better business opportunities for him. The purpose of his loan is to purchase more fitness equipment and set up a smoothie bar in his new space.

loans.use: to purchase new fitness equipment and implement a smoothie bar.

loans.name: Virgilda

texts.en:
Virgilda, a mother of one child, is from Mahayahay, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines.  She is 33 years old.  Virgilda owns and operates a business venture, raising pigs for sale and she's been five years in this business.  Each month, she earns PHP 1,500 doing this type of business.  

She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  In 2009, Virgilda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.  In the future, Virgilda wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Bokk Jom a été créé le 28 décembre 2010. Il est composé de 17 femmes issues de la même localité qui se sont unies par affinité, par des liens d’amitié et de voisinage. Elles font comme activités le petit commerce la couture , l'élevage et l'agriculture. 

Penda (debout à droite de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 30 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. 

Elle fait de la couture et de l'élevage. Elle mène cette activité depuis longtemps. 

Ses bénéfices vont lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans prise en charge des besoins de la famille et de renforcer son épargne dans le Banc Villageois
texts.en:
Bokk Jom solidarity group was formed on December 28, 2010. It consists of 17 women from the same locale who united out of affinity, friendship and neighborhood ties. They are in business with small shops in sewing, breeding and farming.

Penda (standing on the right of the photo) is responsible for the group. She is 30 years old. She is married and mother to 4 children.

She does sewing and breeding. She has been managing these businesses for a long time.

Her profits will allow her to support her husband in taking care of the family's needs and to strengthen her savings in the "Banc Villageois."

loans.use: to buy sheep and do sewing.

loans.name: Brian

texts.en:
Brian established and runs Java Jane’s, a coffee and concession stand located at the Ocean City Boardwalk. He established Java Jane’s in 1999 as a DBA of Rocket America LLC, and with the ownership of his own cart, he looks to grow his name in the community. Java Jane’s offers coffee and complementing coffee snacks such as various cakes to boardwalk passersby. 

With growing popularity, Brian now looks to upgrade his service and offer his customers a wider variety of goods. This loan will be used to purchase a new coffee machine, as well as additional racks to promote new products. A secondary purpose of this loan will be to help Brian build his credit to a reputable level.

loans.use: to upgrade equipment and expand his inventory.

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr:
Coumba est une marié âgée de 67 ans et mère de 10 qui sont tous adultes et autonomes.
Elle est membre du BV de Kiwi depuis son cycle 2 elle appartient au groupe de solidarité Bokk Jomm ;
Madame Coumba s'active dans le petit commerce depuis longtemps mais vu son état de santé actuel elle s'associe avec deux de ses grandes filles pour faire la vente de légumes.
Elle nous informe que les bénéfices régénères par son activité lui permettent de pendre en charge ses besoins alimentaires et sanitaires:
texts.en:
Coumba is a 67 year old married woman and mother to 10 who are all adults and autonomous.

She is a member of the "Banc Villageois" of Kiwi since her second loan cycle. She belongs to the Bokk Jomm solidarity group.

Madam Coumba has been active in shopkeeping for a long time but due to her present state of health she forms a partnership with two of her grown daughters to sell vegetables.

She tells us that the profits generated by her business allow her to take care of her food and sanitary needs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Heyam

texts.en:
Heyam is a 48-year-old  woman from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan.

Heyam has a home-based project in which she sells accessories and cosmetic products, and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase more accessories and cosmetics.

Heyam is looking to have her own shop so that she can expan her customer-base and improve her income.

An aspiration of Heyam's is to purchase a home for her family and to ensure her children higher education.

loans.use: to purchase accessories and cosmetics for business purposes.

loans.name: Elham

texts.en:
Elham is a 54-year-old married woman from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan.

Elham sells clothes and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more clothes for business purposes.

Elham is looking to have her own shop and increase her income so that she can insure her children higher education.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is a 43-year-old married woman from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan.

Muna has a home-based project; she sells clothes and spices. She is requesting a loan of 700 JD to purchase spices and clothes from a wholesaler then re-sell them to retailers.

Muna is looking to have a shop for her business so that her income will increase and that will be reflected in her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and spices for business purposes.

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr:
Ngoné est une femme veuve âgée de 58 ans et mère de enfants dont 3 garçons.
Madame Ngoné est membre du banc villageois de Kiwi depuis le cycle 9 du BV.
Elle appartient au groupe de solidarité Deggo, Ngoné fait du petit commerce de détails plus précisément dans la vente de téléphones cellulaires une activité qu'elle pratique depuis longtemps en collaboration avec un de ses enfants.
Avec son nouveau crédit de 410000 elle va acheter des téléphones et des chaussures qu'elle revendre au niveau du village.
Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans son domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis dix ans.
Madame nous informe que les bénéfices générés par son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge certains besoins familiaux mais également de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du BV.
texts.en:
Ngoné is a 58 year old widowed woman and mother to several children including 3 boys.

Madam Ngoné has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" of Kiwi since the 9th loan cycle of the "Banc Villageois."

She belongs to the Deggo solidarity group. Ngoné is a retail shopkeeper more precisely selling cell phones a business which she has been practicing for a long time in collaboration with one of her children.

With her new 410,000 loan she is going to buy phones and shoes that she will resell in the village.

She has good experience in her business domain from having practiced it for ten years.

Madam tells us that the profits generated by her business allow her to take care of certain family needs but equally to strengthen her savings in the "Banc Villageois."

loans.use: to buy cell phones that she will resell.

loans.name: Alvina

texts.es: Alvina, de 36 años, es una mujer buena y trabajadora, tiene un trato encantador y siempre esta con una gran sonrrisa en los labios. Está casada con Mauro de 38 años, con quien tiene tres hijos, Laura de 17, Helen de 14 y la menor Daniela de 8 años, ellas son su fuerza y motivo de seguir trabajando para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Juntos viven en su casa propia en donde comparten la alegría de ser una familia unida. A diario, Alvina se dirige a su chacra en compañía de su esposo, quien es su respaldo de poder hacer su trabajo. En su chacra tiene cinco hectáreas de plantones de cacao el cual lo comercializa a las empresas chocolateras que están alrededor. Por ahora solo tiene cinco hectáreas propias ya que los 8 mas que utiliza lo alquila para poder producir. Lleva 8 años realizando éste trabajo, y gracias a ello le permitió obtener muchas cosas para su comodidad. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues logra obtener ingresos. Tiene muchos planes, pero lo que mas desea es poder ampliar su chacra con tierras propias ya que el alquiler no le permite tener buenos ingresos. Este será el cuarto préstamo con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará abono y materiales para empezar a fertilizar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Alvina, aged 36, is a good and hard-working woman with a charming manner and always with a big smile on her face. She is married to 38-year-old Mauro, with whom she has three children: Laura is 17, Helen is 14, and young Daniela is 8 years old. Her daughters are her strength and motivation to continue her hard work and offer them a better quality of life. They live together in their own house where they share the happiness of a united family.

Every day Alvina goes to her farm with her husband who is her support to do her job. The farm has 5 hectares (12 acres) planted with cacao seedlings. She sells her crop to near-by chocolate producers. So far she owns only 5 hectares of farmland, but she rents another 8 hectares (20 acres) to cultivate. She has done this activity for eight years and it enabled her to get many things for her comfort. She loves her work because it gives her an income. She has many plans, but what she desires most is to expand her acreage with land that she owns herself, because the rent prevents her from earning a good income.

This will be her fourth loan with the microfinance institution Microfinanzas Prisma and she hopes that she can continue their collaboration and pursue her objectives. She promises once again to comply with the repayment schedule. She will use the 1000 soles of the loan to buy fertilizer and materials to begin cultivating her land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Patricia Henriette

texts.en:
Patricia, age 52, is married with four children. She has one child still in school and the rest are now adults. She also provides for her granddaughter. Patricia sells plastic items such as chairs, buckets, plates, and bookcases in a local market in Brazzaville. She has had this business for the past year and it continues to grow with the help of the loans. 

She has received two previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo, and has repaid them on time and in full. Her business strategy is to display a large variety of items on her tables to attract customers. She finds that more customers visit her booth when she offers a large selection of products but in order to do so she must have the capital. She utilizes the loans to buy merchandise for her business. Patricia hopes to continue to expand her business and to one day send her granddaughter to study abroad. She wishes for her family to live in good conditions and feels the loans are empowering her to reach this dream.

loans.use: to pay for plastic items, such as chairs, buckets, plates, bookcases, and racks.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Mrs. Van is a 44-year-old married woman who has been living in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham. She is a farmer who grows different kinds of crops to generate her income. She plants such crops as potatoes, bananas, beans and corn. Moreover, she sometimes acts as a local laborer who works on a rubber plantation in the province. Her husband is also in the same career as her. This couple has been blessed with five children, two of whom live independently with their new families.

Van would like to ask for a loan from HKL in order to invest in her banana-growing business. She hopes that she will be able to create a good income to better her living conditions. In the future, she intends to improve her business through using modern farming materials and tools.

loans.use: to invest in her banana-growing business.

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr:
Yacine est une femme marié âgée de 34 ans et mère de 5 enfants dont 2 filles.
Madame Yacine est membre du banc villageois de kiwi depuis le cycle 9 du BV.
Elle appartient au groupe de solidarité Bokk Liguéy .
Son activité se trouve être le commerce de détails  par la vente de téléphones cellulaires qu'elle revend au niveau de son village avec l'aide son jeune frère.
Avec son nouveau crédit de 300000 elle va se procurer de la marchandise au prés de ses bailleurs pour les revendre à ses clients au niveau du village.
Yacine dispose d'une bonne expérience dans son domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis trois ans.
Elle nous informe que les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de payer de la nourriture pour ses enfants et de leurs prodiguer des médicaments en cas de maladie.
texts.en:
Yacine is a 34 year old married woman and mother to 5 children of whom 2 are girls.

Madam Yacine has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" of Kiwi since the 9th loan cycle of the "Banc Villageois."

She belongs to the solidarity group Bokk Liguéy.

Her business is retail shopkeeping by selling cell phones which she resells in her village with the help of her younger brother.

With her new 300,000 loan she is going to get merchandise from her landlords to resell them to her clients in the village.

Yacine has good experience in her business domain from having practiced it for three years.

She tells us that the profits from her business will allow her to pay for food for her children and to procure medication for them in case of sickness.

loans.use: to buy cell phones to resell.

loans.name: Faroles De Esperanza 6 Group

texts.en:
Martina is the coordinator of her group, Faroles de Esperanza 6 ("lanterns of hope"). Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago, an area known for its tobacco production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable.

Martina makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and one child. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of selling miscellaneous products, specially clothes and rice. The clothes she sells by walking around. For the rice, she has a group of clients who pay her every week one tenth the price of a sack of rice, and every week she gives one sack of rice to her clients, in the order on her list. She will use this loan to buy jean, skirts, shirts, etc. and two sacks of rice. She will use the profit to reinvest in her business.

Martina is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid a previous loan and grown her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothing and bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Amistad 1 Group

texts.en:
Santa is the group coordinator of her group Amistad (Friendship).  Her group is based in the Samana peninsula where she makes her home in a simple structure with wooden walls and a tin roof. She is married with three children. 

Santa is excited to receive her second loan from Esperanza Internacional, after she was invited to be part of this group and started her business. She sells miscellaneous items and will spend this loan on shoes, clothes and cosmetics, to sell. She will reinvest any profits in her business. Santa's dream for her family is to have her kids safe and own a home to raise them. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kenn

texts.en: Kenn is 29 years old, single, and lives in Canubay, Qroquieta City. He has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month. He has requested a loan  of 5,000 to purchase raw ingredients for his snack vending business. Kenn has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Kenn hopes to earn enough money to get married and wants to help his parents before he settles down.Kenn is a kind person, a responsible son and hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for his snack vending business

loans.name: Jose Marcos

texts.es:
José, necesita invertir un nuevo préstamo en la agricultura, comprando insumos como abono, herbicidas para cultivar el maíz y frijol, ya que de esta actividad es que ha logrado subsistir y apoyar a su familia.
Él considera que ha tenido un efecto positivo en la producción de sus cultivos, tambien logro vender parte de la cosecha, para tener ingresos, José está motivado con este nuevo cultivo que se le avecina, esperando sea provechoso.
texts.en:
José needs a new loan as he wishes to buy supplies such as fertilizer and herbicides for his corn and bean plants. It is from his farm income that he has managed to support himself and his family.

José believes that his previous loan has had a beneficial effect on production. He also succeeded in selling part of his harvest for income. This new loan is providing further motivation, and José hopes for even more benefits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Guadalupe Herminia

texts.es:
Guadalupe, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita comprar más productos de los cuales han reducido en su negocio, zapatos, chancletas, ropa nueva, con este nuevo préstamo espera fortalecerlo, para seguir manteniendo la preferencia de los clientes.
La experiencia de Guadalupe con el préstamo anterior fue buena, ya que fue muy notoria el incremento en el inventario del negocio, surgiendo mejoras en su familia por las ventas que fueron mejores.
texts.en: Guadalupe has decided to take out a new loan because she needs to buy more products of which she has low stock of in her business: shoes, sandals and new cloths. With this new loan she hopes to strengthen her business, to continue offering good selection to her customers. The experience Guadalupe had with her previous loan was good, the increase in inventory in her business was noticeable, and as a result her family benefited from the increased sales.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals and new clothes.

loans.name: Carmen De Jesus

texts.es:
Carmen, está solicitando un préstamo para la  compra de mercadería, ya que quiere dar seguimiento a la inversión del primer préstamo, esta nueva compra le ayudara para mantenerse en el mercado, adquiriendo frutas frescas como manzanas, uvas, sandias, fresas, peras. 
Ella considera que a través de estos préstamos su condición económica ha cambiado, estando mucho más estable, la inversion anterior la realizo en la verdura.
texts.en: Carmen is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, because she wants to follow-up an investment that she made with the first loan.  This new loan will help her to keep up with the market competition, by acquiring fresh fruit such as apples, grapes, watermelons, strawberries and pears.  She believes that through these loans her economic condition has changed, becoming much more stable.  She used the previous loan to buy produce.

loans.use: to buy apples, grapes, watermelons, strawberries and pears

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: Carolina, de 50 años, es una mujer amable y beuna, esta casada con Jorge de 60 años con quien tiene cinco hijos de los cuales 4 ya son mayores e independientes, y solo vive con su hija Diana de 10 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia en donde comparten la alegría de ser una familia unida. El trabajo de Carolina, consiste en la venta de carne de chancho y sus derivados, tiene un puesto en un mercado muy concurrido de la ciudad en donde se va a vender sus productos después de haberlos preparado ella misma. Entre las cosas que vende son: chorizo, cecina, paté, cuerito, chicharrón y otros más. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 10 años y le ha permitido poder dar educación y mejorar en algunas cosas fundamentales del hogar. Le gusta su trabajo pues solo trabaja medio tiempo y eso le permite tener buenas ganancias. Le esta yendo muy bien y espera seguir trabajando para seguir progresando ya que desea poder brindarle una profesión a su hija y hacer crecer mas su negocio ampliando su mercado a otros lugares. Este será el crédito número 2 con MFP, por lo tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además se compromete una vez mas a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual y muy responsable como en créditos anteriores que tuvo. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará carne de chanchos para continuar con su trabajo pero esta vez en mayor cantidad ya que enviara a otras ciudades para su venta.
texts.en:
Carolina is 50 years old, she is a very friendly and good woman. She is married to Jorge, who is 60 years old, and with whom she has five children; 4 of which are adults and living independently, only the youngest daughter, Diana, who is 10 years old lives with them. They live together in their own home where they share the happiness of being a united family.  

The work that Carolina does is selling pork meat and other pig by-products. She has a stand in a very busy market in the city where she goes to sell her products, after preparing them herself. Some of the products she sells include: 'chorizo' (spicy sausage), 'cecina' (a cured meat similar to ham), paté, 'cuerito (pickled pig skin)', and 'chicharrón' (pork rinds) as well as other things. She has been doing this work for the past 10 years and it has allowed her to provide education and make basic improvements to her home. She likes her job because she only has to work part time and it provides good profits. She has been selling very well and she hopes to continue working so that she can continue progressing; she hopes to be able to provide a profession to her daughter and help her business to grow more, increasing her market to other locations. 

This will be her second loan with MFP, she hopes that from this small loan she will be able to complete her goals. Also she promises to make her payments punctually and responsibly like with her previous loan. With the amount of 1500 soles, she will buy pig meat to continue with her work, but this time in larger quantity so that she can send her products to other cities to sell.

loans.use: to buy pig meat.

loans.name: Maria Manuela

texts.es: Maria Manuela es una emprendedora que toda la vida ha buscado como salir adelante y crecer con el negocio cada día, ella ya había solicitado crédito a Fundación León 2000, en el cual compro con el crédito variedad de mercadería en general para ofrecerles a sus clientes. Maria Manuela está solicitando financiamiento actualmente para invertir en el negocio en la compra de perfumes, cremas, sandalia, calzado, lápiz labial, pintura de uña, ropa en general.
texts.en: Maria Manuela is an entrepreneur who has looked for ways of getting ahead and growing in her business her whole life. She had already applied for a loan through Fundación León 2000 with which she bought a variety of general merchandise to offer her customers. Currently Maria Manuela is seeking financing in order to invest in the business by purchasing perfumes, creams, sandles and other footwear, lipstick, nail polish and clothing in general.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, sandles and other footwear, lipstick, nail polish and clothing in general.

loans.name: Homer Edgardo

texts.es:
Homer, quiere seguir cultivando su tierra, por eso está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono, herbicidas, semilla mejorada, con estos materiales desarrollara la siembra de maíz, además comprara semilla de marañón para la venta.
El considera que su familia y él se encuentran mejor, que con el préstamo han sabido mantenerse en pie y solventes de sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Homer wants to continue cultivating his land and so he is seeking a loan for the purchase of farming supplies such as fertilizer, herbicides, and improved seeds. With these materials he will carry out the planting of corn and will also buy cashew nut seeds for sale. 

He believes he and his family are better off, and that with the loan they have been able to remain standing and solvent in the face of their necessities.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds.

loans.name: Norma Iliana

texts.es:
La señorita Norma Iliana es soltera, tiene 26 años de edad, esta especializa como secretaria oficinista, presta sus servicios en una organización, y tiene 3 años de experiencia, cuenta con al apoyo de su familia, de sus padres.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para pagar sus estudios de la universidad, ya que espera mejorar su nivel de vida, espera en futuro ser una profesional mejor preparada.
texts.en:
Miss Norma Iliana is single, 26 years of age, and specializes as an office secretary. She works for an organization and has three years of experience. She has familial support from her parents. 

She is requesting a loan which she will use to pay for her university studies, since she hopes to improve her standard of living. In the future she hopes to be a better educated professional.

loans.use: to pay for her university studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, herbicides and seeds

loans.name: Crhis

texts.es: Crhis, de 30 años, es una mujer amable, buena y trabajadora. Convive con Miguel de 35 años y con quien tiene un hijo de 3 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia en donde se dedica a tiempo completo a su trabajo y a educar a su hijo. El trabajo de Crhis consiste en la venta de bebidas gaseosas y cerverzas a personas con mayoría de edad. Asimismo vende comida. Diariamente exhibe sus productos en la refrigeradora que posee, y durente el fin de semana vende platos típicos de la región y de algunos otros lugares, ya que su experiencia en la cocina es muy buena. Lleva realizando su trabajo por 4 años y lo hace sola ya que se da abasto para poder realizar de manera tranquila. Recuerda que al principio le fue muy complicado hacerlo sola, pero como no tenía capital para contratar a otra persona, por lo que tuvo que aprender a trabajar así. Espera poder seguir trabajando mucho mas y de esa manera mejorar su economía. Este será el crédito número 4 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por su parte ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y así seguir siendo una socia puntual como en créditos anteriores. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos para ofrecer mayor variedad de platos a su clientes, además de abastecer su almacén con algunas bebidas mas.
texts.en: 30-year-old Crhis is a good, friendly, hardworking woman. She lives with 35-year-old Miguel, with whom she has a three-year-old son. They live together in a house she owns. She devotes herself full-time to working and to raising her son. Crhis sells soft drinks and beer to people of legal drinking age. She also sells food. She displays her merchandise in her refrigerator daily. On weekends, she sells typical food from that region and from other areas, since she has a lot of experience in the kitchen. She has been in this line of work for four years and she does it alone, because she can cope with it easily. She recalls that at first it was very difficult for her to work alone, but since she couldn't afford to hire someone else, she had to learn to work this way. She hopes to keep on working much more, so that she can improve her finances. This will be her fourth loan with MFP, so she counts on your collaboration in order to pursue her goals. On her part, she pledges to make her repayments and continue to be a punctual member, like in her previous loans. With the requested amount of 2.500 soles, she will purchase inputs and supplies in order to offer more varied food to her customers, and also stock her store with a few more beverages.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making food, and to purchase more beverages.

loans.name: Cornelio Natanael

texts.es:
El señor Cornelio Natanael es casado, tiene 30 años de edad, esta graduado como bachiller, tiene 3 hijos 2 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa casual para niños, jóvenes y grandes, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de sus padres y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia.
